LORE Ã¨ lâ€™istanza Bookwyrm di Livello Segreto.

Qui potrete condividere le nostre letture, scoprire nuovi libri da leggere, organizzare bookclub e coltivare amicizie letterarie. Ãˆ di fatto un piccolo social network dedicato ai libri, ma integrato nel fediverso. Quello che fate qui potrÃ  facilmente essere seguito e condiviso su Mastodon e affini.

Pensiamo che la lettura sia importante, tanto per lâ€™intrattenimento quanto per il progresso, e proprio per questo riteniamo fondamentale che ci sia uno spazio libero in cui condividerla.

LORE Ã¨ libero per vari motivi: - Ãˆ open source - Non raccoglie i vostri dati - Ãˆ moderato e gestito da esseri umani, non da una corporazione - Non ha scopo di lucro

Esattamente come Livello Segreto, LORE Ã¨ un luogo di rispetto, antirazzismo, antisessismo, antifascismo. Insomma, comportatevi bene e abbiate a cuore la serenitÃ  dellÇ altrÇ utenti. Qui potete trovare le regole complete di Livello Segreto.
Short: LORE Ã¨ lâ€™istanza Bookwyrm di Livello Segreto. Qui potrete condividere le nostre letture, scoprire nuovi libri, organizzare bookclub e coltivare amicizie letterarie. Ãˆ di fatto un piccolo social network dedicato ai libri, ma integrato nel fediverso.

Description:
Updates on site status, ToS/CoC changes, and so forth will be announced from @instance@a2mi.social.

Donations

This site costs roughly $100 per month to run. If you'd like to contribute, you can send some money to the site administrator (Chris Dzombak) via:

  • PayPal at paypal.me/chrisdzombak
  • Venmo at @dzombak

To support development of the open-source Mastodon software, consider contributing to the Mastodon Patreon.

Conduct, Content, and Moderation Policies

Terms of Service

All users are expected to follow the site rules, and repeated or serious violations will lead to account suspension.

Creation of multiple accounts in order to avoid or evade moderation actions is not allowed. Violations will lead to suspension of all your accounts.

Regardless of your a2mi.social account status:

  • Usage that may undermine usersâ€™ security and privacy expectations (like scraping, indexing, or followbots) is not permitted.
  • Usage that enables harassment, abuse, hate speech, spamming, or that enables violation of any other site rule is likewise disallowed.
  • Usage that violates or aims to subvert the server-level moderation policies is not allowed.

Violations may result in suspension of your account, suspension of federation with your server, or network-level blocks, with no warning.

Reporting Accounts

When reporting accounts, please include a few posts that show rule-breaking behavior, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please note that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

Server-level Moderation

To provide a pleasant space for the community, we block federation at the server level with Mastodon sites known to:

  • Present security or privacy risks
  • Enable hate speech, violent speech, or other violent/hateful ideologies
  • Enable harassment or abuse
  • Propagate dangerous conspiracy theories
  • Tolerate/host content that's illegal in the US
  • Enable spamming

These blocks are largely based on the list available at joinfediverse.wiki/FediBlock.

Site News

Updates on site status, ToS and CoC changes, and so forth will be provided through the Instance News account: @instance@a2mi.social.

If the site is offline, check status.a2mi.social, which is hosted on an external service, for news.
Short: ğŸ‘‹ A2mi.social is a friendly social network for people living, working, studying around Ann Arbor â€” including Ypsilanti and elsewhere â€” and our friends.

Description:
Hi Code of Conduct, I'm Dad!

Fatherhood is a spectrum, respect that.

dads.cool is an instance for dads; if you apply to become a user, itâ€™s expected that you have, had, or are expecting, at least one (human) childâ€”sorry, but pets are not children, no matter how much we love them. Being a father does not mean identifying or being labeled as a man, nor does it mean that you were involved in the conception of the child you take care of. Foster dads, adoptive dadsâ€”anyone who cares for a child and identifies as a dad is welcome here. In that spirit, dads.cool welcomes all sexualities, gender identities, races, levels of mobility, and ages.

If a user posts a message that mocks, harasses, endangers, threatens, or otherwise puts at risk any other person on the basis of the criteria above, they will be banned from dads.cool. There is not an appeals process.

Replying to Other Users

Sharing your experiences as a dad is what weâ€™re all here to do, but take care to distinguish between â€œthis is what worked for meâ€ and â€œthis is what you should do.â€ Whatever the intentions behind it, unsolicited adviceâ€”especially involving a user's health and wellnessâ€”is often indistinguishable from harassment and will be treated as such. This is especially true when the health or safety of children is concerned. Please ask permission before giving advice to another user.

Generally, seek to understand what a user is looking for when they post their feelings. Is it encouragement, explanation, empathy? It never hurts to ask before you post your reply.

Reporting another User

Please use the Report button on posts you feel put our community at risk (including those that might come from other instances, but are directed at dads.cool users); it is the easiest way for an admin to identify abuse.

Content Warnings

Mastodonâ€™s robust support for content warnings (CWs) is a valuable part of the platform. Please consider using CWs for images that might be considered â€œnot safe for workâ€ like nudity or sexual content, for stories of loss or injury, for video in general, and for photos with eye contact.

We do not have formal rules around what exactly should or should not be placed under a CW, but repeated posts of sensitive content without them may result in a message from an admin. Before you ask another person to CW something that is disruptive to you, consider whether one of the myriad other options for personal content moderationâ€”muting, blocking, unfollowing, or filtering wordsâ€”would achieve the result of removing that content from your own timeline.

A table of CWs in regular use around Mastodon is below:

CW Meaning
ec a photo with eye contact
pers intimate or personal information
mh concerning mental health, with a - to indicate negative feelings and + for positive
ph the same, but with physical health
lewd sexually suggestive content
meta referring to a wider conversation across mastodon
pol political content, often localized with uspol, eupol, asiapol, etc.

Instance Blocks

dads.cool implements the open source "BLOCKchain" to block interactions with instances that might put our community at risk. Detailed reasons behind each ban can be found on the list's GitHub page. dads.cool will not federate with any instance associated with the white supremacist platform Gab. dads.cool will not federate with any multi-user instance that lacks a code of conduct or has a code of conduct that does not forbid harassment. Further domain block decisions will be posted on the admin's feed as a local-only post or discussed on our members-only Discord; an invitation will be made available to new members.

Changes to this Code of Conduct can be tracked on the dads.cool GitHub repository.
Short: dads.cool is a Mastodon instance for dads, running the Hometown fork of Mastodon.

Description:
About Fedihum

  • [EN] Fedihum aims to provide a space for conversation, networking, and scholarly exchange for researchers, teachers, students, and those interested in the field of Digital Humanities. [DE] Fedihum mÃ¶chte Forschenden, Lehrenden, Studierenden und Interessierten aus dem Gebiet der Digital Humanities einen Raum fÃ¼r Unterhaltungen, Networking und wissenschaftlichem Austausch bieten.
  • [EN] We look forward to respectful interactions on fedihum! [DE] Wir freuen uns auf ein respektvolles Miteinander auf fedihum.
  • [EN] For a very useful introduction to federated social microblogging using Mastodon, see the Mastodon Quick Start Guide for Humanities Scholars. [DE] FÃ¼r eine nÃ¼tzliche EinfÃ¼hrung in das fÃ¶derierte Mikroblogging mit Mastodon, siehe den Mastodon Quick Start Guide for Humanities Scholars und den Artikel 10 Dinge, die du Ã¼ber Mastodon wissen solltest.
  • [EN[ Fedihum is offered by the Association Digital Humanities im deutschsprachigen Raum (DHd-Verband). [DE] Fedihum wird vom Verband fÃ¼r digitale Geisteswissenschaften im deutschsprachigen Raum (DHd-Verband) angeboten.
  • [EN] Please note that, just like on Twitter, direct messages are not encrypted. They should not be considered truly private and not be used for confidential conversations. [DE] Bitte beachten, dass Direktnachrichten, genau wie bei Twitter auch, nicht verschlÃ¼sselt sind. Sie sollten daher nicht als wirklich privat aufgefasst und nicht fÃ¼r vertrauliche Nachrichten verwendet werden.
  • [EN] This instance is hosted by WeingÃ¤rtner-IT. The server location is in Germany. The server runs on renewable energies. [DE] Diese Instanz wird von WeingÃ¤rtner-IT gehostet. Der Standort des Servers ist in Deutschland. Der Server lÃ¤uft mit Ã–kostrom.

Encouraged uses

  • [EN] Share links to your work and to the work of others. [DE] Links zur eigenen Arbeit und zu der Arbeit anderer teilen.
  • [EN] Share resources, ideas, networking. [DE] Ressourcen und Ideen teilen, Netzwerken.
  • [EN] Share events, news, job descriptions and call for papers. [DE] Veranstaltungen, Nachrichten, Stellenbeschreibungen und Aufrufen zur Einreichung von BeitrÃ¤gen austauschen
  • [EN] Discuss in-process work and involve others in your projects. [DE] Ãœber laufende Arbeiten diskutieren und andere in Ihre Projekte einbeziehen.
  • [EN] Recruit participants for academic surveys. [DE] Teilnehmer:innen fÃ¼r akademische Umfragen rekrutieren.
  • [EN] Using content warnings when posting things that other users might find triggering. [DE] Warnungen fÃ¼r Inhalte verwenden, die andere Benutzer:innen als anstÃ¶ÃŸig empfinden kÃ¶nnten.
  • [EN] Mark bots as such. [DE] Bots als solche kennzeichnen.
  • [EN] Use hashtag #fedihumjobs when posting job adverts. [DE] Das Hashtag #fedihumjobs fÃ¼r Stellenangebote verwenden.
  • [EN] Use full links instead of shortened links (bit.ly etc.). [DE] VollstÃ¤ndige Links verwenden, nicht Link-VerkÃ¼rzer (bit.ly etc.).
  • [EN] Politeness and Kindness are key. [DE] HÃ¶flichkeit und Freundlichkeit sind entscheidend.

About the rules

  • [EN] The fedihum instance rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviors that may result in the deletion of toots and the suspension or removal of accounts on this instance at the discretion of the instance administrators. [DE] Die Regeln der fedihum-Instanz sind eine (nicht erschÃ¶pfende) Liste von Verhaltensweisen, die nach Ermessen der Instanz-Administrator:innen zum LÃ¶schen von Postings und zum Aussetzen oder LÃ¶schen von Konten auf dieser Instanz fÃ¼hren kÃ¶nnen.
  • [EN] Please report any behavior that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential. [DE] StÃ¶rendes Verhalten sollte gemeldet werden. Diese Meldungen werden vertraulich behandelt.
  • [EN] In case of non-compliance with the server rules, we reserve the right to take legal action. [DE] Bei Nichteinhaltung der Server-Regeln behalten wir uns das Recht vor, rechtliche Schritte einzuleiten.

Description:
Temporary/draft rules taken from hachyderm.io because I wanted to get some posted but didn't want to have to think to hard about it. We can have discussions about improving them!

Hosting this is very much an experiment for me. I'll do my best, but if you're not ok with some hiccups, you might want to sign up for a different server.

I'm seeking some co-admins, so if you know how to work with Linux, Linode, reverse proxies, and GitHub issues and aren't afraid to deal with the weirdos in Boulder, please reach out.
Short: This Mastodon instance is focused on Boulder (Colorado), but it is federated, thus interacts with all the other servers in the "fediverse" (similar to how Gmail interacts with Outlook and Yahoo).

Description:
Service Status

Performance is everything to us. If this server starts to slow down we may suspend registrations.

We're committed to a minimum of three months notice should the service cease.

Managed Bot Accounts

We run a number of bots that mirror theme park Twitter accounts. Tweets and profile information are synced roughly every five minutes. Posts may be auto deleted after two weeks.

  • @DisneyParks
  • @disneyland
  • @WaltDisneyWorld
  • @DisneyParis_EN
  • @UniStudios
  • @UniversalORL
  • @SixFlags

... and many more

Up-to-date list here

If you represent one of the theme parks we're mirroring and would like to take control of the account or just don't want us mirroring posts, send an email to troy @ somany.us.

If we're missing a park and you'd like to see the account mirrored fill out this form.

Donations

We are self-funded and do not require donations at this time. Please consider donating to the main Mastodon project or your mobile app of choice if you want to support.

Relay

We host a theme park/roller coaster relay for related servers. Registration is by request only, contact @troy to apply. To see the list of connected instances: https://relay.opencoaster.net/
Short: A community of coaster and themed entertainment enthusiasts. Coasters, churros, you name it we love it. We also run a number of theme park cross-posting bots. Spam not welcome here.

Description:
What is Mastodon and the Fediverse?

Mastodon is free and open-source social media network not owned by a single company. It's used by millions. More about Mastodon on joinmastodon.org. Check out the live stream and read more about the Fediverse.

Summary of Mementomori.social

Mementomori.social is a Mastodon instance established in November 2022, hosted by a Finnish full stack web developer and Chief Technology Officer Roni "Rolle" Laukkarinen with over two decades of server and web experience. The instance is financially backed and sponsored by a Finnish web agency Digitoimisto Dude Oy.

Despite the name, the nature of this server is NOT temporary, on the contrary, it is thoroughly optimized both financial- and administration-wise and is constantly worked on to be as future-proof as possible.

Mementomori.social supports the development of Mastodon and the Fediverse and is pro-Threads and pro-Bluesky federation and ActivityPub integration. You should know that, if you have anti-capitalist or anti-commercial objectives with social media.

This instance allows:

  • Regular, personal user accounts
  • Anonymous user accounts (with a reason)
  • Companies
  • Associations and organisations
  • All languages
  • Politics
  • The upcoming Bluesky bridge Bridgy.fed
  • Threads.net
  • Indexing of public content and profiles (please read our Privacy policy)

We have mostly international and Finnish users as the server is based in Helsinki, Finland.

Features

Full feature listing here.

Software

We use a modified fork of the nightly version of Mastodon (main branch on GitHub). We follow mastodon.social which is the instance of the founder of Mastodon, Eugen Rochko, to guarantee the stableness of the server. No untested and unintended commits are used in production environment.

The current version and modifications with full source code can always be found in the footer (bottom right on desktop), see the View source code -link.

The server software is always patched to the most secure version and no unsafe modifications are used.

Recommended mobile apps

  • Mona for iPhone
  • Ice Cubes for iPhone
  • Mammoth for iPhone
  • Moshidon for Android

Code of Conduct

For the rules scroll down to bottom.

This Code contains the rules and principles for participating in the Mementomori.social community. The Code is intended to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible. This is a working document and based on Mastodon.world's work (thank you guys).

Goals

  • Support open and free social web movement, open source and the development of Mastodon, Fediverse and the ActivityPub protocol.
  • Provide a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, political affiliation, or other similar characteristic.
  • Create a supportive community, where people freely share their passions and are excited and positive about each otherâ€™s successes.
  • Protect our community from harassment, malicious or illegal content and from individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.

Principles that guide us

  • We are not a free speech zone. This code of conduct lays out expected standards of conduct and behavior. You cannot say or post anything that violates these rules or principles and remain a member of our community. You must follow this CoC. If you are looking for something else, please do. It is not here.
  • Bullies, trolls and disruptors are not welcome here. We will moderate accordingly.
  • This is a voluntary community. You chose to be here. When you choose to join, you have implied that you agree with this Code of Conduct and will follow it.

Rules for posting

The rules you need to follow if you want to be a member of our community are stated below.

General guidance on posting and participating in Mementomori.social

  • Do not post about inflammatory, controversial subjects without a Content Warning. Ideally, you would not post about inflammatory subjects at all. However, it may be acceptable to do so in some cases, but it is never acceptable to post inflammatory content without hiding the content behind an appropriate Content Warning.
  • Do not post any type of nudity without a Content Warning.
  • Do not engage in name calling, ad hominem attacks, or any other uncivil behaviour. Criticize ideas, never people.
  • Do not report every post that upsets you. Please report posts that violate our rules but for others that you may find distasteful, or just donâ€™t like, use the tools available to you. You can block the user or mute the conversation.

Moderation Principles

Reported content will be assessed on a balance of probabilities by the moderators. In other words, whether it is more likely than not that the content violates one or more of these rules. Moderators will suspend an account from mementomori.social when the user demonstrates that they have breached any rule several times, or if their content (including profile description) suggests that they are likely to continue to break the rules. The number of breaches leading to suspension is deliberately not defined. In egregious cases, one breach can result in suspension of the user account.

The moderation team takes a pragmatic approach to every report they receive - if they feel that a problematic post isnâ€™t explicitly a breach of any of these rules but is inappropriate for Mementomori.social, the post will likely be removed. Users who repeatedly post problematic content or otherwise are seen by the moderators as a negative, disruptive presence in our community can be removed at the discretion of the moderation team, even if those posts or the user did not explicitly violate our rules.

Longevity

The admin of this server has been committed to keep it running ad infinitum and can control it as long as he lives and breathes, his lifetime expectancy says up until 2067. After that it's up to people who decide whether to respect the notion on his will that says mementomori.social should be kept running.

Announcements & updates

The admin of this instance is committed to be as open as possible about the changes. Each user is accepted and welcomed. Please see the hashtag #MementoMoriSocial.

Help & getting started

Read instance wiki at help.mementomori.social.

About

Mementomori.social is a Mastodon instance hosted by a Finnish web developer Roni "Rolle" Laukkarinen with two decades of server and web experience. The instance is financially backed and sponsored by a Finnish web agency Digitoimisto Dude Oy.

Memento mori is an artistic or symbolic trope acting as a reminder of the inevitability of death, but it also refers to a various topics like a certain type of stoic philosophy of peace and acceptance, visual art, literature, architecture, music, culture, history and equality.

The server name origins from a stoic latin phrase "Memento mori" and is originally sparked from the thought "what happens to the instance if something happens to the owner(s)". The admin of this server is a stoic-ish person who believes we never really "die", nothing is permanent and at the same time everything is. We carry on. If not in person, then in someones mind, until the universe (and the Fediverse) is here no more. â€œWhy should I fear death? If I am, then death is not. If Death is, then I am not. Why should I fear that which can only exist when I do not?" ~ Epicurus

"It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it. Life is long enough, and a sufficiently generous amount has been given to us for the highest achievements if it were all well invested. But when it is wasted in heedless luxury and spent on no good activity, we are forced at last by death's final constraint to realize that it has passed away before we knew it was passing. So it is: we are not given a short life but we make it short, and we are not ill-supplied but wasteful of itâ€¦ Life is long if you know how to use it." ~ Seneca

Mementomori.social contains plenty of modifications like Mastodon Bird UI, bigger link previews, show counts in comments and so forth. By being here you accept things are prone to changes.

What's the catch?

There is no catch. Mastodon should be free and available for everyone. The instance was born in Fall 2022 after Elon Musk purchased Twitter, but even before that Rolle had followed the development of Mastodon with a keen eye. Welcome! This instance won't probably be the most biggest in the Fediverse, but there's always room for one more user.

Closing remarks of this About section

General mental health and safe space are important to the admin of Mementomori.social. Please be respectful towards other people whenever you can. Glad you're here. Thank you for reading this.
Short: Mementomori.social is a social media for mortals. We connect with the Fediverse, used by millions. This instance is backed by a Finnish company, digital web agency Digitoimisto Dude Oy.

Description:
Benvenuti su Senigallia One!

Mastodon Ã¨ un social network non commerciale, federato e decentralizzato. Senigallia One Ã¨ una istanza italiana autogestita dalla community

PerchÃ© iscriversi a senigallia.one

senigallia.one Ã¨ una istanza generalista, indipendente, etica e libera. Vogliamo essere una community felice e benevola, ma anche competente e divertente. Per questo ci siamo dati una policy rispettosa dei dritti di tutti, per costruire insieme una community sana e priva di comportamenti tossici. Ti consigliamo di leggere questo documento e le regole dell'istanza per capire se senigallia.one Ã¨ il server che fa per te. Se non ti riconosci o non condividi le regole di questa istanza puoi cercarne un'altra che rispecchi di piÃ¹ la tua sensibilitÃ  o i tuoi interessi. In alternativa puoi sempre creare la tua istanza (questo Ã¨ il bello di Mastodon) e rimanere collegato all'interno della federazione.

senigallia.one rispetta la tua privacy

  • Mastodon non ti profila e non vende i tuoi dati personali, perchÃ© Ã¨ indipendente, non ha azionisti, investitori o gruppi/circoli/centri a cui rispondere.
  • Puoi liberamente decidere il livello di privacy dei tuoi interventi all'interno della community (un contenuto puÃ² essere: pubblico, pubblico ma non pubblicato nella timeline pubblica, visibile solo ai followers, messaggio privato visibile sono ai destinatari menzionati).
  • I tuoi dati personali restano tuoi, puoi decidere in qualsiasi momento di cancellarli o scaricarne una copia.
  • Mastodon rispetta l'anonimato, non ti obbliga ad iscriverti con il tuo nome e cognome o con il tuo numero di telefono, puoi mantenere la tua privacy ed utilizzare qualsiasi nickname
  • Abbiamo solo bisogno di una tua email valida per: la verifica, l'eventuale tuo recupero password, l'invio di eventuali messaggi di servizio da parte dei moderatori. La tua email non viene ceduta o utilizzata per finalitÃ  diverse.

senigallia.one Ã¨ un social non-commerciale

Mastodon Ã¨ senza pubblicitÃ , senza paywall, senza algoritmi, senza cookies di profilazione. Mastodon non risponde a logiche commerciali, non profila nÃ© rivende dati personali, non usa algoritmi per racchiudere gli utenti in una bolla informativa. I social commerciali centralizzati come facebook e twitter offrono i loro servizi "gratis", ma traggono colossali profitti dalla profilazione dei gusti e delle preferenze degli utenti (il prodotto sei tu) e manipolano desideri e comportamenti delle persone (come dimostrato dallo scandalo Cambridge Analytica). Puoi approfondire questo argomento guardando il documentario "The Social Dilemma". Mastodon.uno sopravvive solamente grazie alle donazioni degli utenti: considera la possibilitÃ  di dare il tuo contributo! Per coprire i costi di un account attivo bastano pochi centesimi alla settimana!

Siamo una community consigliata dal sito ufficiale di Mastodon Seguiamo rigidi criteri di affidabilitÃ  fra cui

  • backup giornalieri
  • piÃ¹ di un responsabile tecnico disponibile in caso di emergenza
  • garanzie tecniche nel mantenere il sito sempre attivo online
  • presenza di una policy che prevede i diritti e i doveri degli utenti per il mantenimento di una community sana
  • moderazione attiva contro contenuti discriminatori e di odio (non Ã¨ tollerata qualsiasi forma di razzismo, sessismo, omofobia e transfobia)
  • i moderatori sono persone reali disponibili ad ogni chiarimento
  • nessuno scopo di lucro
  • senigallia.one Ã¨ inoltre una delle poche istanze in cui Ã¨ attiva la ricerca sul testo, che Ã¨ disattivata nella maggior parte delle istanze per risparmiare sui costi server.
  • seigallia.one fornisce una ricerca completa per poter facilmente trovare tutti i contenuti in cui si Ã¨ interagito e recuperare la memoria storica su tutto ciÃ² che si scrive.

Come funziona Mastodon?

Mastodon Ã¨ una piattaforma software open source, libera, decentralizzata e federata. Mastodon Ã¨ un'alternativa gratuita alle piattaforme social come Facebook e Twitter. Su Mastodon i messaggi si chiamano "Toot" (Ã¨ il verso dell'elefantino, simbolo del social) ed in questa istanza Ã¨ prevista la lunghezza massima standard di 500 caratteri per ogni toot. I toot possono avere quattro livelli di privacy, liberamente selezionabili dall'utente:
  • pubblico (pubblicato in timeline pubblica)
  • pubblico ma non pubblicato nella timeline pubblica
  • visibile solo ai followers
  • messaggio privato visibile sono ai destinatari menzionati
I toot pubblici potrebbero essere indicizzati sui motori di ricerca. Un "Boost" Ã¨ l'azione con cui si ridiffonde un toot altrui. I messaggi privati, ovvero i toot leggibili soltanto dagli utenti menzionati, sono conservati in chiaro nel database del sistema; quindi, mentre la loro trasmissione avviene sul web con la protezione del protocollo SSL, essi sono leggibili in chiaro da chi abbia accesso al database. La "Timeline locale" presenta i toot dell'istanza Mastodon.uno in ordine cronologico (non ci sono algoritmi che ti suggeriscono contenuti particolari ed ogni toot ha la stessa probabilitÃ  di essere visto). La "Timeline federata" presenta i toot provenienti da molte altre istanze, italiane o internazionali, federate con Mastodon.uno. Non sono presenti tutti i toot di tutte le istanze possibili, nessuna istanza federa veramente tutte le altre. Twitter Ã¨ conosciuto come "Birdsite". Mastodon permette di formare una rete di nodi collegati tra loro (chiamati "istanze") che dialogano fra loro con il protocollo ActivityPub. Mastodon fa parte del network del Fediverso, permettendo ai suoi utenti di sfruttare la struttura federata per interagire anche con utenti su diverse piattaforme aperte che supportano lo stesso protocollo, come PeerTube e Friendica. A differenza dei social commerciali, non c'Ã¨ un solo server centrale per Mastodon: ogni istanza ha proprie regole, policy di moderazione, lingua e argomenti preferiti di discussione. E' bene che gli utenti si scelgano l'istanza piÃ¹ affine alla propria sensibilitÃ  ed interessi. E' sempre possibile migrare il proprio profilo presso un'altra istanza senza perdere contenuti e followers. Mentre ogni singola istanza Ã¨ caratterizzata da una policy che regolamenta in modo specifico la tipologia di contenuti ammessi, il Fediverso, in quanto formato dall'interazione fra istanze federate, Ã¨ nel suo complesso pluralista. Per approfondire il funzionamento di Mastodon, Ã¨ possibile consultare la guida gratuita in italiano mastodon.it.

Quando nasce Mastodon?

Mastodon nasce nel 2016 in Germania per iniziativa del ventiquattrenne Eugen Rochko, per ovviare ai limiti dei social network centralizzati come Twitter ed evitare il rischio che una singola azienda monopolizzi le comunicazioni. L'istanza italiana con un dominio dedicato Mastodon.uno nasce nel 2018 ed entra a far parte della federazione internazionale rappresentando gli utenti di Lingua Italiana. Mastodon.uno Ã¨ un'istanza italiana autogestita ed autofinanziata in Italia, non Ã¨ una societÃ  e non fa data mining (raccolta, elaborazione e vendita di informazioni personali), siamo presenti su Twitter e su Noblogo.

PerchÃ© Mastodon?

Affermare che non si Ã¨ interessati al diritto alla privacy perchÃ© non si ha nulla da nascondere Ã¨ come dire che non si Ã¨ interessati alla libertÃ  di parola perchÃ© non si ha nulla da dire. (Edward Snowden) Il web Ã¨ relegato in giardini recintati e gigantesche server farm che sono nelle mani di poche giganti aziende tecnologiche. I nostri post finiscono nelle bacheche di Facebook e Twitter, soggiogati dai termini di servizio che queste aziende americane impongono. Le foto e i video finiscono su piattaforme come Instagram, Snapchat e YouTube, atolli digitali completamente isolati lâ€™uno dallâ€™altro. Tutte queste grandi aziende sono impegnate nell'estrarre valore dai nostri contenuti, nel profilarci nel modo piÃ¹ preciso possibile, in modo tale da influenzare i nostri comportamenti di acquisto, le nostre preferenze politiche, la nostra percezione della realtÃ , solo in funzione della loro crescita economica. I social commerciali quindi offrono i loro servizi gratuitamente ma traggono profitti dalla profilazione dei gusti e delle preferenze degli utenti. Questo viene chiamato il "Capitalismo della sorveglianza" e la sua accettazione da parte del pubblico attraverso l'argomentazione "non ho nulla da nascondere" Ã¨ stata ben descritta nel documentario "Nothing To Hide". Nel documentario"The Social Dilemma" viene ben illustrato come l'utilizzo improprio e incontrollato di questi dati porti a un aumento della dipendenza dai social, manipolazione psicologica, formazione di una filter bubble, l'alimentazione della disinformazione. Questa enorme mole di dati puÃ² essere messa a disposizione anche di governi (come Ã¨ accaduto con lo scandalo di Cambridge Analytica) per orientare facilmente opinioni e comportamenti. Mastodon Ã¨ una alternativa open source e free alle piattaforme social come facebook e twitter, una federazione di istanze aperta e decentralizzata chiamata Fediverso. Il Fediverso Ã¨ la comunitÃ  delle community, privo di pubblicitÃ  e di scopi di lucro, privo di algoritmi di profilazione e modifica comportamentale. Tutte le istanze del Fediverso comunicano fra di loro, senza alcun scopo di lucro e non si appropriano dei dati della nostra vita social, non registrano e non analizzano le nostre relazioni e le nostre comunicazioni. Gli utenti non dipendono da un decisore unico e non sono concentrati e vincolati in una sola proprietÃ , ma possono essere liberi di seguire utenti su altri server ed eventualmente essere liberi di migrare verso altre istanze, senza per questo perdere i propri contatti e i contenuti inseriti.

Vuoi saperne di piÃ¹?

Consulta la policy di questa istanza, che contiene i diritti e i doveri dei partecipanti alla community e le regole di moderazione. Se hai bisogno di aiuto, leggi la guida in italiano di mastodon.it Chiedi aiuto all'amministratore o ai moderatori Consulta il portale italiano https://mastodon.it ed il sito ufficiale di Mastodon: https://joinmastodon.org/
Short: Mastodon Ã¨ un social network non commerciale, federato e decentralizzato. Senigallia One Ã¨ una istanza italiana offerta e gestita dal quotidiano online Vivere Senigallia.

Description:
Summary

A open community-led social network, funded, administered and hosted by a global community of critical care clinicians.

You can support us here: https://opencollective.com/critcare. Everyoneâ€™s circumstances are different so please only contribute if you feel comfortable doing so.

Principles

This server is owned and run by a community of users. Admins are volunteers from the community, and will earn and maintain trust by using their powers cautiously and sparingly.

The lifespan of this venture will be, as with literally everything else, finite. It may begin to decline in 6 months, or 10 years, but when it is superseded, weâ€™ll move forwards, and will remember it fondly.

Constitution

Every decision is made by majority vote among the administrators. Administrators are appointed by approval by the existing admins.

Staff

  • Tom Williams (server) @Watergypsy
  • Mathieu Desgroseilliers (finances) @matdesgro
  • Kenny Baillie (server) @kennethbaillie
  • Aoife Abbe (admin) @Whistlingdixie4
  • Charlotte Summers (admin) @Charlotte_Summers
  • Jack Iwashyna (admin) @iwashyna
  • Lars MÃ¸lgaard Saxhaug @load_dependent
  • redneeraj @neerajsingh
  • Rob Mac Sweeney (admin) @critcarereviews
  • Rosie Baruah (admin) @RosieICM
  • Segun Olusanya (admin) @Iceman_ex

Image

The image on the front page is Rosie Baruahâ€™s. Contact her for related requests: @RosieICM

Guidance

Article from 1998 on â€œThe art of hosting online conversationsâ€

How to copy your follows from twitter: https://pruvisto.org/debirdify/

How to cross-post from/to other platforms: https://crossposter.masto.donte.com.br/
Short: An open community-led social network, funded and administered by a global community of critical care clinicians. opencollective.com/critcare

Description:
BHRE Social Community Guidelines

BHRE Social is a Mastodon instance for the discussion of business, human rights and the environment. (BHRE) We welcome all humans with an interest in corporate accountability for human rights and the environment, including climate change. You are welcome whether youâ€™re just starting out or are already an expert on these questions: students, doctoral students, early-career researchers, more established scholars, practitioners, workers, NGO/union/corporate professionals, lawyers, consultants, concerned consumers, journalists, politicians, civil servants, etc.

Real names and credentials are only recommended if you plan to use your account on this instance for networking purposes; they are absolutely not required.

Encouraged uses of BHRE Social

  • Share news: publications, reports, upcoming conferences, calls for abstracts, and any news related to BHRE.
  • Ask questions, and answer questions asked. The power of our community is in sharing.
  • Network with others. Introduce yourself, ask questions about other peopleâ€™s work and interests.
  • Share pictures of in-person BHRE Social encounters, and pictures related to BHRE issues (landscapes, buildings, etc.)
  • Rants are fine but see content warning policy below.

Discouraged uses of BHRE Social

The following will result in: a warning from a moderator or having offending posts deleted, possibly without prior notice.

  • Inappropriate posts without content warning (CW) on the Local Timeline (see below for CW policies)
  • Posts of other people's work without proper attribution
  • Shortened links, e.g. bit.ly, t.ly, tinyurl.com, goo.gl, ift.tt, lnkd.in, is.gd or t.co (These are considered malicious because link-shorteners track users without their consent and obscure the destination address, which also prevents users from being able to decide whether they want to visit the link beforehand)
  • Advertisement or commercial content of any kind.

Content Warnings (CWs)

Please add CWs (content warnings) that are accurate and descriptive enough to enable reader consent to the following types of posts:

  • strong language,
  • rants,
  • mentions of death or violence,
  • spoilers of popular and recent TV shows or other media,
  • ASCII art (this one is important to ensure that someone using a screen reader doesn't have to listen to an attempt to read out a bunch of obscure symbols)
  • anything else where another user might want to decide for themselves whether or when they want to interact with your post.

There is a setting in your preferences to open all posts with Content Warnings automatically, if you don't want to click through each one.

Image descriptions

It is an expectation of this instance that you add accurate descriptions to all images and video that you post to aid in accessibility. (A description like "image.jpg" that does not aid in accessibility would not meet this expectation.)

If you post an image of a screenshot of text, it is an expectation of this instance that you transcribe the text in the image description.

It is required that if you are reposting images or media that is not your own, the source is fully attributed both in your post and in the image description.

Posts on the Local Timeline (ones with the "Public" privacy setting) will be checked to ensure that Content Warnings are applied, images are described, and other expectations are followed. Unlisted posts will not be proactively reviewed, but will still be subject to rules regarding abuse and other hate-speech.

NOTE: The "official" Mastodon app is NOT recommended for use on BHRE Social, as it does not allow for posting using the "Unlisted" privacy setting.

Use a CW if you're not sure that your post is "on-topic." BHRE Social is not meant to be a current events news aggregator, and if your post seems to fall into this category, you may be asked to delete and re-draft it with a CW or as an Unlisted post. Let's try to avoid turning the Local Timeline into the same rehashing of the outrage-of-the-day that we see on Twitter!

Not every post on the Local Timeline should be CW'd, but most should. Do your best to try to accommodate each other, and try to be understanding when there is a clash of expectations or needs.

Bots and automated accounts

Whilst the community is growing, bots and automated accounts are not allowed on this instance. As the community establishes in the coming weeks this restriction will be reviewed to allow for automated posting.

To be clear: cross-posting from other social media accounts that you use as an individual is perfectly okay, and a good way to manage multiple accounts whilst keeping your sanity.

Regarding attempts to abuse these anti-abuse tools and policies

Do not attempt to weaponize our Community Standards or anti-abuse tools/policies against marginalized groups such as people of colour, women or queer people. Users of BHRE Social are expected to have the literacy to understand that "reverse discrimination" is not real, and so attempts to re-centre discussions of marginalized people around the feelings of the privileged will be taken as manipulative behaviour undertaken deliberately in bad-faith. (e.g. white people should not demand that people of colour put CWs on every discussion of race; a straight person who reports a queer person for writing "I hate straight people" may find their own account suspended.)
Short: BHRE.Social is a Mastodon instance for the discussion of business, human rights and the environment (BHRE). We welcome all humans with an interest in corporate accountability for human rights and the environment, including climate change. You are welcome whether youâ€™re just starting out or are already an expert on these questions: students, doctoral students, early-career researchers, more established scholars, practitioners, workers, NGO/union/corporate professionals, lawyers, consultants, concerned consumers, politicians, civil servants, etc.

Description:
Brands Town (normally referred to as brands.town, or brands dot town), is a Mastodon-based platform dedicated entirely to brand accounts. Many of these brands are organizations you may have never heard of, whilst some of them may seem all-too-familiar. The nature of this platform is to give companies a fresh start on an exciting new decentralized ecosystem, where there's a space for everyone.

Brands Town is where a brand can be a brand.
Short: Brands Town is the first ever Mastodon Instance dedicated solely to corporate brand promotion.

Description:
Tramite Nebbia, vogliamo creare uno spazio digitale autonomo per tutti quei gruppi, collettivi e soggetti che si rispecchiano nei nostri stessi princìpi fondamentali: antifascismo, antisessismo, antirazzismo, antimilitarismo.
Vogliamo dare al movimento la possibilità di comunicare al di fuori dei social network commerciali e mettere a disposizione uno strumento gestito da una comunità aperta, dove la distanza tra admin e utenti sia ridotta ad una mera questione tecnica; dove sia difficile riprodurre dinamiche di potere; privo di iniziative commerciali e pubblicità relativa; libero dalla propaganda politica istituzionale; dove sia garantita il più possibile la riservatezza; che consenta agli utenti di avere il controllo completo sui contenuti.

Description:
Server rules

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

-Excessive advertising
-Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources -Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions -Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
-Racism or advocation of racism
-Sexism or advocation of sexism -Casteism or advocation of casteism -Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
-Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
-Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health -The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
-Sexual depictions of children -Content illegal in Sweden
-Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
-Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
-Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
-Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment. These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
Short: Svensk version av Mastodon.

Description:
genart.social

Welcome to genart.social, a home on the Fediverse for generative artists. We are an inclusive community which values diversity and encourages creative exploration. All artists are welcome, regardless of their background or experience level. Our community is LGBTQIA+ friendly and supports all forms of generative expression, including (but not limited to) algorithmic art, AI art, crypto art, glitch art; art or music made with any kind of dynamic system. Our server is located in Germany, and we welcome all languages.

We value accessibility. Use of captions for all posted media is strongly encouraged.

Let's collaborate to make the Fediverse a more visually interesting place!

Banner art by @jesshewitt.

Please note that registration is currently by invitation only.

ğŸ³ï¸â€âš§ï¸ ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ âœŠğŸ¿

About Crypto Art

We kindly request members to keep posts about crypto art low-key and consider adding the #nft tag and content warning when posting about them. Content warnings are not intended to penalize content, they are part of our culture and considered best practice. They are widely used when posting sensitive content, such as disturbing imagery, mentions of violence, spoilers, politics, nudity, or pictures of food.
Short:
genart.social is a home on the fediverse for artists working in the #generative, #AI, and #glitch spaces.

Registration is currently invite-only.
topic: genart.social - A Home For Generative Artists

Description:
episcodon.net is a Mastodon server for individuals and groups associated with The Episcopal Church. episcodon.net is not officially affiliated with or endorsed by The Episcopal Church.

episcodon.net is committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant and is listed on the Mastodon Servers page.

Membership on this server is free. However, the owner incurs monthly overhead costs to keep the server up and running. Please consider making a one-time or recurring donation using Patreon.

Our core values as Episcopalians are expressed in the Baptismal Covenant. We encourage all server members to exemplify these valuesâ€”especially the promise to "strive for justice and peace among all people, and respect the dignity of every human being"â€”as they interact with others.

Remember that our Anglican heritage began as a via media (middle road) between Catholicism and Protestantism. Episcopalians today hold diverse positions on religious, political, social, and other issues. We ask server members to give each other the grace to hold different beliefs, and to discuss their differences civilly.

Our server rules are intended to make episcodon.net a safe and enjoyable place for all members. Hate speech of any kind is prohibited. This includes, but is not limited to, expressions of support for the following:

  • ableism and disablism
  • ageism
  • antisemitism and Islamophobia
  • casteism
  • colonialism and imperialism
  • homophobia and transphobia (including targeted misgendering, deadnaming, or promotion of so-called "conversion therapy")
  • Nazism and other forms of fascism
  • sexism and misogyny
  • racism and colorism
  • xenophobia

If you encounter content that violates server rules, please report it. The server admins will review it as soon as possible. Content that violates server rules will be removed at the discretion of the server admins. Users who violate server rules will be suspended at the discretion of the server admins.

Please be aware that Mastodon is free and open-source software (FOSS), so anyone can start a Mastodon instance. Also, Mastodon is only one part of the larger fediverse. Our server becomes automatically federated with any other server with which our users interact. Some of those servers may contain content that is objectionable to you (and probably the majority of our users). If you encounter such servers in your Federated timeline, please report them. The admins will investigate them and, if necessary, block them. You can find a list of blocked servers at the bottom of our About page.

Server recommendations

  1. Be kind. Love your neighbor as yourself.
  2. Complete your user profile. Other users are more likely to follow you if you add your name, a bio, a header image, and an avatar image. If you prefer to remain anonymous, thatâ€™s fine.
  3. Introduce yourself with an initial post. Indicate your interests with hashtags.
  4. Add descriptive text to all images, videos, and audio files you attach to posts. People who use screen readers need descriptive text to interpret content they cannot see.
  5. Use the appropriate level of privacy for your posts. Do you want a post to be visible to everyone, only to people who follow you, or to the specific people mentioned in the post?
  6. Make good use of content warnings. Ask yourself, â€œIs what Iâ€™m posting likely to be a trauma trigger for some readers?â€ If the answer is yes, add a content warning to your post.
  7. Keep in mind that text-based communication is limited. The visual and auditory clues present in face-to-face communication are missing. If a post hits you the wrong way, gently ask the author for clarification.
  8. If you have an issue with someone elseâ€™s post, try to discuss your concern with that person privately. If you are unable to resolve the issue, file a report.
  9. Donâ€™t use the server rules to censor users who hold different positions from your own. Instead, be curious and ask open questions. However, if the user is clearly violating server rules, file a report.
  10. Use camel case in hastags. For example, type #TheEpiscopalChurch rather than #theepiscopalchurch. Camel case is easier to read and is a necessity for people who use screen readers. Be aware that Mastodon may try to lowercase your hashtag.
Short: a Mastodon instance for Episcopalians

Description:
This is a kink-friendly, ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ-welcoming community. As long as everyone abides by common decency, you get to be whoever and whatever you want to be here.

Tips and Tricks

  • Follow some accounts, whether on this server, or accounts on other Mastodon sites, so that you get content into your timeline.
  • Images are limited to 10 MB, and videos are limited to 40 MB. GIFs are normally converted to a looping video to save bandwidth (the same way it's done on Tumblr and Twitter).
  • Opt-in to let others find your account by checking "Suggest account to others" in your profile.
  • Content warnings are strongly encouraged for any explicit content that Rule 2 allows (e.g., genitals). Some of the content on this site gets federated to other Mastodon servers that have more restrictive rules requiring content warnings. Content warnings are not strictly enforced on this server; but if you post without one, followers here or on other servers will likely flag them for moderation. We're trying to maintain a balance between allowing free expression and federating with other servers that may be more vanilla or have varied norms.

Finding People

When you have an account on this server or any Mastodon server that federates, you can follow and interact with users on other Mastodon servers, without needing to create an account on each one. Here are some places to start discovering content and people:

  • Our opt-in directory - choose "From hypno.social only"
  • Our local timeline - all public posts made by accounts on this server
  • Federated timeline - public posts from people followed by any user on Hypno Social, even accounts on other servers
  • rubber.social
  • mastodon.hypnoguys.com
  • woof.group
  • mastodon.lol
  • mastodon.triggerphra.se

Moderation

We may moderate proactively or in response to reports to enforce server rules. If you are interested in helping with this effort, message @deeplyasleep.

Use of this platform is governed by the server rules and the Privacy Policy.
Short: A kink-friendly, ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ-welcoming community.

Our onion address is http://nihilistidbo35bixvusyy3lsdszrrhtjpshhz277omdom6n45so5vad.onion

This server blocks several domains that are havens for abuse, discrimination, spam, are corporate run, or are otherwise undesirable.
Short: ni.hil.ist is a server run by individuals who are friendly to a nihilistic worldview.

Description:
A brief welcome

A few of us started this server looking for a small place to land together in the 'fediverse' â€“ hopefully a safer place. We're front-end web makers who value humans over technology, and embrace diversity on an open, accessible, progressively-enhanced web.

We were not expecting so much interest! It's exciting! But we're still new to this, not set up to grow large or fast. This isn't a corporate venue, it's our virtual living room â€“ and we have a small apartment.

It's hard turning people away, but we think it's important not to take on more than we can care for, in our spare time. So our registrations are currently paused, with a few exceptions. Please bear with us â€“ the goal is not to be exclusive, but to be sustainable in our growth.

More info on who we are, invite policies, and supporting the server over at about.front-end.social Â»

ğŸ’– @mods

Our code of conduct

Front-end.social is a community built on respect and inclusivity. As a member of front-end.social, you agree to uphold an environment of consideration for all members, especially those from traditionally minoritized communities.

If you think you can resolve a problem youâ€™re having with someoneâ€™s behavior without getting admins involved, we encourage you to. Early interventions from someoneâ€™s friends and acquaintances are way more likely to actually fix someoneâ€™s bad behavior than letting it fester until we need to step in. Please feel free to report behavior to admins if you think itâ€™s something you canâ€™t deal with.

Admins reserve the right to take whatever action deemed necessary if these guidelines are violated, including but not limited to: warnings, temporary suspension, and site bans. Any language or action that expresses, reinforces, upholds or sympathizes with any form of systemic social domination is considered oppressive and is grounds for removal at any level deemed appropriate by the admins. All potential violations are manually reviewed by a human being; we do not use any automated systems to take disciplinary action, although we may use automated tooling to help detect certain violations.

Membership & Invitation Expectations

While we may be the first front-end focused Mastodon instance, it is not our goal to be the one de-facto instance. We want our community to remain a reasonable size to promote a healthy culture. We encourage others to build other similar communities!

Front-end.social is semi-open. We are still actively working through what this looks like. We are working on our application process, which will hopefully include a more tailored application form than the default Mastodon one. Thanks for bearing with us.

Please help us make this instance inviting and inclusive. If you are interested in front-end web development (or donâ€™t mind hanging with those who do) and you support our values, you're welcome here!

Recommended Post Etiquette

Since this is a semi-open instance, we have some guidelines and recommendations for joining the community outlined below. Please keep in mind that these guidelines are designed to encourage positive and supportive interactions within front-end.social, not to police behavior.

Community members are encouraged to share and recommend these best practices to their fellow community members, especially when someone joins on your invite.

ğŸ—£ Introduce yourself!

Once you've had some time to get the lay of the land, it's a great idea to write a quick #introduction (and include that hashtag so others can find it).

â¤ï¸ Before you promote, participate!

It's super cool to share the stuff you're working on, invite people to events, ask for help, share work opportunities/gigs, etc. But please try not to make these your first or only posts! Join in the conversation, say hello, make an introduction above, even share *other* people's stuff. All of these things will help you build connections and earn trust. Besides, people are way more likely to pay attention to (and boost/click/share) the stuff you share if they recognize you!

In general, promoting stuff is good. It's how we learn what's going on, and help each other. If you're active in the community and sharing something you think others might like, you don't have to worry. Drive-by promotion doesn't help the community, so please try to avoid it.

ğŸš¨ Please consider using "content warnings."

We ask that you put the following topics behind a content warning (CW) (photos can be marked with the eye symbol - after uploading, before posting):

  • graphic violence or gore
  • flashing video/gifs
  • spoilers

We encourage you to toot about your lived experience freely, without content warning. We don't support and will not tolerate the silencing of underrepresented and minoritized people sharing their truths â€“ or pointing out issues in the industry and platform. That said, if you are posting on triggering topics, we encourage you to consider the content warning feature.

When in doubt, CW. Our goal is to create a space where we are not overwhelmed by negative posts or bombarded by the 24 hour news cycle. Twitter's algorithm encouraged doom scrolling. We don't want to replicate that here.

CW are also often used as courtesy to help followers pre-screen sensitive or particularly noisy topics. Examples of this might include meta-discussion about Mastodon itself (commonly tagged 'fedi meta') or mental health (tag 'mh'). This sort of use is not required on our instance, but it a norm of Mastodon etiquette at large.

ğŸŒ„ Image captions

Please add descriptive image captions to any images you post. We have added custom CSS to the site to highlight where descriptions are added, and their presence or absence on images.

Behavior & Content

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in a ban from front-end.social:

  • Unapproved bots (for approval, please contact the admins)
  • Plagiarism
  • Pornography and sexually explicit content without a content warning
  • Gore and graphic violence not hidden by a content warning
  • Intentional misinformation

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in a ban from front-end.social:

  • Promoting the oppression of any group based on gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, or class
  • Conduct promoting the ideology of fascism, radical nationalism, or xenophobia
  • Racism or advocation of racism
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism
  • Sexual depictions of children
  • Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
  • Content that is illegal in nations where our members are active and content that facilitates illegal activity

Any conduct intended to stalk, harass, or intimidate other people, or to impede other people from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass others, or to incite others to perform any of the aforementioned actions is forbidden and subject to punishment up to and including a ban from front-end.social.

This can include, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

  • Continuing to engage in conversation with a person that has specifically requested for said engagement to cease may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
  • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission.
  • Inciting people to engage another person in continued interaction or discussion after a person has requested for said engagement to cease and desist may be considered harassment.
  • Posting and/or disseminating a person's posts ("toots"), including screen captures or any other content without express permission.
  • Intentionally posting or disseminating libel, slander, or other disinformation.

This Code of Conduct applies both to content on front-end.social and to public spaces when an individual is representing front-end.social or its community.

Reports of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be made by using the report button. All reports will be reviewed and dealt with as soon as possible. Admins are obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident.

The admins reserve the right to revoke any user's content on or access to front-end.social, at any time, for any reason.

Our current moderators are: @mia, @estelle, @keithjgrant, @kitt, and @grigs. You can reach us through the @mods account.

No creepy crawlies (robot.txt set to disallow). No secret crypto mining operations.

A special note about tech flame-wars

You are welcome to your own opinions regarding technology, the web, code formatting, and the pronunciation of â€œgifâ€ but we ask that if you choose to express these opinions, you do so in a respectful way.

Furthermoreâ€”and perhaps even more importantlyâ€”strive to extend the benefit of the doubt to others as they express their opinions. Rather than assuming a 200-character post encompasses the full extent of a complicated issue, ask clarifying questions before launching a rebuttal—or simply keep scrolling. Donâ€™t make the admins â€œchoose a sideâ€ because a disagreement gets out of hand.
Short: Front-end web makers who value humans over technology & embrace diversity on an accessible web. We hope to stay small & grow slowly. Mascots by @stephaniewalter. More at https://about.front-end.social

Description:
Mastodon es una red social libre, federada y descentralizada que, junto con otros muchos productos, forma parte del fediverso. Cada usuario elige en quÃ© servidor registrarse, bajo quÃ© reglas, y cÃ³mo interactÃºa con los demÃ¡s miembros. Algunos, incluso, ejecutan sus propios servidores, y es exactamente lo que hemos hecho nosotros. Esta instancia es administrada por los miembros de la AsociaciÃ³n Comunidad Hispanohablante de NVDA, tambiÃ©n conocida como Comunidad de NVDA en espaÃ±ol. Nuestro objetivo principal consiste en promover la utilizaciÃ³n del lector de pantalla libre y de cÃ³digo abierto NVDA entre personas ciegas de habla hispana. A raÃ­z de los acontecimientos sucedidos en Twitter a partir de octubre de 2022, hemos decidido poner en marcha esta instancia, de propÃ³sito general, y fomentar el uso del fediverso entre nuestros usuarios.

Nota: si lo consideras adecuado, puedes copiar el contenido de los dos siguientes desplegables y usarlo en tu instancia, siempre que cites la fuente de procedencia.

Recomendaciones para nuevos usuarios

 Seguramente te han dicho que Mastodon es una alternativa a Twitter, y eso te hace pensar que son muy parecidos. Si bien es cierto que tienen sus similitudes, tambiÃ©n hay notables diferencias que no se pueden pasar por alto. AquÃ­ te dejamos algunos consejos para empezar:
  • Los nombres de usuario son como en Twitter, pero sÃ³lo si mencionas a personas de tu instancia (por ejemplo, @jmdaweb). De lo contrario, hay que aÃ±adir el dominio al que pertenecen cuando quieras mencionarlos. Por ejemplo, @jmdaweb@comunidad.nvda.es.
  • El buscador estÃ¡ muy limitado, no esperes encontrar resultados de todo el fediverso con Ã©l. SÃ³lo aparecerÃ¡n publicaciones de usuarios que hayan consentido ser indexados. Puedes optar a que se indexen tus publicaciones en las opciones de privacidad de tu cuenta. PodrÃ¡s usar el buscador con total seguridad para escribir nombres de usuario o explorar una publicaciÃ³n cuya URL tienes. Existen instancias que no disponen del software Elastic Search, y allÃ­ las bÃºsquedas estÃ¡n mucho mÃ¡s restringidas.
  • Un Me gusta es un reconocimiento al usuario que ha escrito una publicaciÃ³n. Lo verÃ¡ porque le le llegarÃ¡ una notificaciÃ³n, y el toot se guardarÃ¡ en tus favoritos, pero no se difundirÃ¡. Si quieres difundir una publicaciÃ³n, usa siempre el botÃ³n Retootear, rebloguear, Boostear, Impulsar, o como se llame en tu interfaz. No hay algoritmos que destaquen publicaciones, el algoritmo somos todos nosotros.
  • Usa los marcadores para guardar una publicaciÃ³n sin notificar al autor. Nadie podrÃ¡ ver tus marcadores. Si el autor ha configurado la eliminaciÃ³n automÃ¡tica de sus publicaciones, desaparecerÃ¡n de tus favoritos, pero no de los marcadores.
  • Existen varias lÃ­neas temporales:
    • Inicio, donde ves la actividad de la gente a la que sigues, incluyendo las interacciones entre ellos y sus retoots. Los mensajes directos tambiÃ©n aparecerÃ¡n en Inicio.
    • Notificaciones: aquÃ­ aparecerÃ¡ cualquier interacciÃ³n contigo: retoots, menciones, mensajes directos, personas que te siguen o marcan como favorito uno de tus toots.
    • Local: contiene los toots pÃºblicos de los miembros de la instancia, y sÃ³lo los toots. No incluye menciones o retoots.
    • Federada: contiene los toots locales, y los toots de todos los usuarios de otras instancias seguidos por usuarios de tu instancia. La lÃ­nea federada es un buen lugar en el que encontrar gente conocida, y conocer gente nueva. Procura no perderla de vista. Si la instancia se conecta a un repetidor, como es nuestro caso, la federada es una combinaciÃ³n de las federadas de todas las instancias unidas a ese repetidor.
    • Mensajes directos: contiene los mensajes directos agrupados en conversaciones. Recientemente ha cambiado su nomenclatura para llamarse "sÃ³lo la gente a la que menciono".
  • Hay cuatro tipos de publicaciones:
    • PÃºblica: llega a todas partes. Aparece en la lÃ­nea local y la federada.
    • No listada: no se muestra en las lÃ­neas local y federada, pero cualquiera que abra tu perfil o te siga la encontrarÃ¡ porque sigue accesible al pÃºblico.
    • SÃ³lo seguidores: sÃ³lo las personas que te siguen podrÃ¡n leerla. Si alguien te sigue despuÃ©s de que hayas publicado, tambiÃ©n tendrÃ¡ acceso a ese contenido.
    • Directa o sÃ³lo la gente que menciono: sÃ³lo la persona o personas mencionadas podrÃ¡n leerla. Es muy fÃ¡cil enviar mensajes directos grupales.
  • Los mensajes directos no van cifrados. Los administradores de las instancias involucradas en una conversaciÃ³n podrÃ­an leerlos si quisieran. No envÃ­es informaciÃ³n que consideres confidencial.
  • Explora las tendencias disponibles para encontrar personas con tus mismos intereses. Puedes seguir etiquetas si lo deseas.
  • Sigue al administrador de tu instancia, y procura respetar las reglas. Si no te convencen, siempre puedes migrar a otra instancia mÃ¡s adecuada para ti.
  • Los recursos no son ilimitados. Para alargar la vida de la instancia y facilitar su administraciÃ³n, configura un umbral de eliminaciÃ³n automÃ¡tica de publicaciones en las opciones de tu cuenta. Te lo agradeceremos infinitamente.
  • Si quieres que los demÃ¡s te encuentren con facilidad, no descuides tu perfil. La casilla "Sugerir esta cuenta a otros" es especialmente interesante, y viene desmarcada por defecto.
  • Describe cualquier contenido multimedia que subas. No sÃ³lo imÃ¡genes, tambiÃ©n audios y vÃ­deos. Nunca se sabe quiÃ©n podrÃ­a necesitar una alternativa textual.
  • Si quieres redactar un hilo, responde a tu publicaciÃ³n anterior, y asÃ­ sucesivamente. Procura poner el primer toot como pÃºblico, y el resto como no listados.
  • Si echas de menos Twitter, existe un espejo llamado bird.makeup que te lo mostrarÃ¡. Sigue a @usuario@bird.makeup, donde usuario es el nombre de usuario de Twitter deseado. Los tuits suelen llegar con retraso. La persona no se enterarÃ¡ de que la has seguido ni verÃ¡ tus respuestas.
  • Si quieres informarte, algunos medios de comunicaciÃ³n estÃ¡n ya en el fediverso, pero otros no. Intentamos remediarlo con el proyecto FediFeed.
  • Mastodon tiene una app oficial para mÃ³viles, pero no pienses que por ello estÃ¡ mejor preparada u ofrece funciones Ãºnicas. Hay aplicaciones de terceros que te pueden venir mejor, dales una oportunidad.
  • Si crees que una de tus publicaciones puede herir la sensibilidad de alguien, marca la casilla de contenido sensible y escribe un breve texto de advertencia.
  • Aunque en otras redes sociales no has pagado nada, nunca fueron gratis. Mastodon tampoco lo es. Pregunta al administrador de tu instancia si necesita dinero para financiarla y, si es asÃ­, intenta contribuir en la medida de tus posibilidades. Tristemente, dejar atrÃ¡s algoritmos y publicidad tiene sus consecuencias.
  • Algunas apps ofrecen la posibilidad de citar publicaciones. Dicha funciÃ³n es exclusiva de esas apps, pero no de Mastodon. Procura siempre que puedas responder en vez de citar. De esa forma, todo el mundo podrÃ¡ participar sin barreras.

Recomendaciones para usuarios de lectores de pantalla

 Si tus ojos se encuentran fuera de servicio permanentemente, seguramente estarÃ¡s usando uno o varios lectores de pantalla. Sigue estas recomendaciones para sacarle todo el partido posible a Mastodon:
  • Si vas a usar Mastodon desde su web, en las preferencias de tu cuenta, activa la vista avanzada. A continuaciÃ³n, despliega tantos hilos como quieras, y fÃ­jalos. Para ello, abre la configuraciÃ³n que se encuentra bajo el encabezado de nivel 1 en cada uno.
  • OlvÃ­date del cursor virtual o el modo exploraciÃ³n. Puede que tengas que emplearlo, pero en casos muy puntuales. ApÃ³yate en el modo foco, las flechas y los diversos atajos de teclado de Mastodon. Estando en modo foco, pulsa el signo cerrar interrogaciÃ³n, pasa al modo exploraciÃ³n y pulsa la t para ir a la siguiente tabla. AllÃ­ verÃ¡s todas las teclas rÃ¡pidas.
  • Si tienes iPhone o Mac, instala Mona. Se trata de una aplicaciÃ³n muy completa y accesible con VoiceOver. Es de pago, pero merece la pena. TambiÃ©n dispones de otras apps gratuitas que puedes probar, como la oficial de Mastodon, Tusker, IceCubes o Metatext. Este Ãºltimo estÃ¡ abandonado.
  • Si tienes Android, instala la app oficial de Mastodon, Tusky, Megalodon o Fedilab. Esta Ãºltima es de pago.
  • En Windows, puedes usar TWBlue. La lÃ­nea federada deberÃ¡s habilitarla desde Opciones de cuenta, en la pestaÃ±a buffers.
  • En cualquier plataforma, tambiÃ©n tienes a tu disposiciÃ³n el cliente web Pinafore. Actualmente estÃ¡ abandonado, pero su autor cree que se podrÃ¡ usar con Mastodon durante una buena temporada. Se maneja de forma similar a la web, pero ofrece mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n accesible. Existe una bifurcaciÃ³n suya, llamada Semaphore, centrada exclusivamente en la accesibilidad, y otra mÃ¡s reciente, Enafore.

Â¿Nos echas una mano?

Al igual que el resto de servicios que ofrecemos, esta instancia funciona gracias a las donaciones que recibimos de particulares y empresas. Si quieres contribuir con una cantidad, por pequeÃ±a que sea, visita nuestra pÃ¡gina de donaciones.
Short: Una instancia de propÃ³sito general para interactuar con el fediverso mediante Mastodon, ofrecida y administrada por la comunidad hispanohablante de NVDA.
Nanobyte.Cafe is an English speaking Mastodon instance that is open to anyone who is interested in technology; either on the software or hardware side.

Description: The purpose of SoTL.social. This is a site and refuge for the discussion of all issues related to the Scholarship of Teaching and Learning. Issues, toots, and boosts unrelated to SoTL do not belong on this site. All posts unrelated to SoTL may be deleted at the discretion of the administrator.
Short: Forum to discuss issues related to the Scholarship of Teaching and Learning.  Other issues or topics (cats, politics etc. belong do not belong here).

Description:
Welcome

mastodon.skrimmage.com is Mastodon instance with the central theme of sports analytics, but open to all people who want to have a friendly and respectful place regardless of your fandom.

Registration eligibility

We accept registrations from any person aged 18+. While we do not require the use of any particular language, moderators may use automated translation services to spot-check posts and ensure adherence to our Code of Conduct.

Please include a full description for why you wish to join and who invited you to join. Users may be silenced until verify that they don't wish to spam or harass.

Mastodon Server Covenant Commitment

We're committed to the Mastodon server covenant which includes the following:

  • Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia.
  • Daily backups of user data.
  • At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure.
  • Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down.

Our mission

We have a mission to make mastodon.skrimmage.com a safe and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of their gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, age, mental or physical disability, political views, and personal appearance.

We are resolute in protecting the mastodon.skrimmage.com community from harassment and malicious content from individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.
Short: Skrimmage is a friendly community of sports enthusiasts! Let's make this a welcoming environment for all those who want to enjoy discussing sports, analytics, and sports analytics.

Description:
The Illuminati

Look, we're not actually the Illuminati. Not that we'd tell you if we were, but we're not. I mean, we could be, but we're not. Really. We don't know the first thing about imminentizing any eschatons, and if we did, we wouldn't tell you, because we're not the Illuminati. We're not even sure what an eschaton is, and we assure you we have not imminentized any. Recently. That weâ€™re willing to talk about. But enough about us!

This is just a chill server for generalists. Rules subject to change without notice. Capriciousness likely. Be excellent to each other. Exercise skepticism. Try to avoid imminentizing any eschatons, but if you absolutely must, please do so esotericlaly.
Short: The Illuminati! On Mastadon! Or maybe not. Maybe just some random people interested in various things. Exercise skepticism.

Description:
Welcome

deacon.social is a server intended for Christians of all backgrounds and faith traditions to build an inclusive and loving community. We do not all agree about everything, and we do not want this to be an echo chamber, but we will treat each other respectfully in the face of disagreement. Some of us are deconstructing/reconstructing. Some of us are struggling to find where we belong.

Members are expected to abide by the server rules at all times. Content that violates the server rules should be reported to the moderators. A violation of rules on this server will result in disciplinary action. Users from other servers who violate the rules of our community may be banned from this server and likely reported to the admin of their server as well.

The name deacon (Î´Î¹Î±ÎºÎ¿Î½Î­Ï‰) means one who serves or "server," and since this is a server, and our goal is to serve each other, the name is doubly appropriate.

Supporting the server

We have an Open Collective for deacon.social. We use this service to track the expenses incurred for operating the server. Contribution is completely optional, but if you enjoy using this server, we would appreciate you giving back!
Short: A respectful, loving, and diverse community of Christians of all traditions

Description:
Ein Zitat von Dietrich Bonhoeffer "Konspiration und Haft 1940â€“1945"

Das Freisein von etwas erfÃ¤hrt seine ErfÃ¼llung erst in dem Freisein fÃ¼r etwas. Freisein allein um des Freiseins willen aber fÃ¼hrt zur Anarchie. Freiheit bedeutet biblisch: Freisein fÃ¼r den Dienst an Gott und am NÃ¤chsten, Freisein fÃ¼r den Gehorsam gegen die Gebote Gottes. Das setzt voraus: Freisein von jedem inneren und Ã¤uÃŸeren Zwang, der uns an diesem Dienst hindert. Freiheit bedeutet also nicht AuflÃ¶sung aller AutoritÃ¤t, sondern es bedeutet: leben innerhalb der durch Gottes Wort geordneten und begrenzten AutoritÃ¤ten und Bindungen.
Die Frage der individuellen Freiheiten, wie Redefreiheit, Pressefreiheit, Versammlungsfreiheit etc. ist erst in diesem Ã¼bergeordneten Zusammenhang zu beantworten. Es kommt darauf an, wieweit diese Freiheiten notwendig und geeignet sind, die Freiheit des Lebens nach den Geboten Gottes zu fÃ¶rdern und sicherzustellen. Freiheit ist eben nicht in erster Linie ein individuelles Recht, sondern eine Verantwortung, Freiheit ist nicht in erster Linie ausgerichtet am Individuum, sondern am NÃ¤chsten.
Short: Wir bieten einen kleinen Gemeinschaftsraum zum Thema Bibel und SchÃ¶pfer. Die primÃ¤re Sprache ist Deutsch.
