Description:
Photo taken by @mikeenerio.

About

This Mastodon server is free to use for Singaporeans local and abroad, or anyone who has accepted Singlish ğŸ˜¬.

How to use?

  • Simply post texts, links, pictures, videos, gifs or even a poll!
  • Only see posts from the people you follow.
Your privacy is important to us, please note, all posts including DMs are not end-to-end encrypted by design. Have fun and toot!

Follow @Mastodon for updates and announcements.

Server Info

This server is hosted in Singapore.
  • 4 vCPU
  • 8GB Memory
  • BackBlaze B2 Media Storage w/ Cloud Replication
  • Cloudflare CDN, DDOS & WAF Protection
  • SMTP2GO Email Delivery
  • Full-text search and Translation supported
  • Hourly Backups locally and remotely

Check out our Status Page and stats from FediDB.

Moderation

Moderators reserve the right to suspend/restrict Users who go against the rules of this server.
Please report any wrongdoings and weâ€™ll do our best to investigate.

Mastodon Covenant

Our server meets the Mastodon Server Covenant.

Community Support & Sponsor(s)

We do not serve Ads or sell your data, we rely solely on your support and our Sponsor(s). You can support us by donating to Ko-Fi.

We would like to thank our sponsor(s) for keeping the lights running.

  • Sohwatt LLP

Bots, Companies & Brands

Please contact us @ enterprise@mastodon.sg.
Any creation without prior approval will result in account suspension.

Description:
Welcome to a new community for all No Man's Sky fans! ğŸš€ Hosted by Assistant Apps.

Kzzt...Kzzt... We support a post limits of 1616 characters! ğŸ˜.

What is Mastodon?

You are likely coming from Twitter and that is ok! Welcome to a little part of the Fediverse. If you are not familiar with any of this, I would suggest having a look at some of these awesome pages.

docs.joinmastodon.org - https://axbom.com/fediverse

Sign-ups

  • Sign-ups are on an approval basis in order prevent bad actors/bots.
  • Please let us know in the request field that you play NMS, but even if you don't you are still welcome.
  • There are serval Invite Codes floating around in the wild, check with your favorite NMS Content Creators, and if they don't have one have then reach out to us.

Mastodon Covenant

We abide by the covenant set forth by the community, and open-source contributors, as listed at joinmastodon.org/covenant.

Moderation

  • We take the safety of our users very seriously, and review every report with respect to our rules, and in the best judgment of the mod/admin team.
  • At this time we do not publish what instances we defederate from but tend to lean towards the Tier 0 Oliphant.Social Shared Blocklist.
  • Our Mod team is pretty small at the moment and we ask you to give us some leeway in regards to response times.

Fun stuff ğŸ¥³

  • Checkout our list of emojis
  • We have various No Man's Sky bots to interact with!
    • @quicksilverCompanion (Tracks Community Mission Status)
    • @nada@ (Tracks NMS Game Updates)
    • @assistantnmstracker (Tracks multiple things, like new posts ie patch notes on the HG website)
    • @ariadne (Talk to Ariadne when they are not greeting new travelers on the Anomaly)
    • @TheRealAriadne (Talk to Ariadne when they are not greeting new travelers on the Anomaly)

Support the instance ğŸ’–

If you want to help support check out the AssistantApps Patreon you can also reach us at the AssistantApps Discord.

Contact

If you need to contact the admin team for any reason please reach out to:

  • Admin: Khaoz-Topsy @AssistantNMS/@khaoztopsy
  • Admin: Cyberpunk2350 @Cyberpunk2350

NOTE: This is a Fan Project and We are NOT affiliated with Hello Games.

Description:
Goonj India is an open, privacy conscious community focussed on Indians and India specific issues.

Goonj India is part of the Goonj network of community. Anyone can join and find the right community to participate.

Open

Goonj is open for everyone to join, but hate speech of any kind is prohibited. Goonj can be joined through any device through our web application. Goonj is open source and based on the popular Mastodon social network.

Privacy Conscious

Users can seamlessly download their entire account data and delete their accounts any time they want. No private information like Real Name, Date of Birth etc. is required to join Goonj. Goonj provides easy control to share your content with a limited audience or to a wider audience as required.

Code of Conduct

Try to be a good neighbour to everyone in the community. Please avoid all behaviour which can be considered spamming, scamming, ponography, NSFW content, advocacy of violence, ethnic/racial/homophobic slurs, harassment, or any other content/activity deemed against the law. Offending content will need to be removed by the user, and repeat offenders will be banned from the community.

We strive to be "work-friendly", so if you post anything that's allowable under our policy but may reasonably be considered objectionable, please use a CW (content warning) to tag it as such.

Moderation activities will be as transparent as possible, with rationales for each action. The community will have the opportunity to review and give input on actions, and the moderation team will be responsive to that.

* Nudity exceptions - the following are okay: Nudity in photos of paintings and sculptures; Breastfeeding (with content warning); Nudity in photos of political expression or significance (with content warning). Examples that don't qualify as exceptions: Nudity in digital art; Nudity with political text simply added to it; etc.


FAQ

How to invite people to follow you

Go to Invites. Check Invite to follow your account, and generate a link. People who sign up through the invite will automatically follow you!

How to enable/disable email notifications

Go to Notifications

Recommended: Enable all notifications to start with; then, if there are any you find you don't like, disable them.

How to export all your data

Go to Data export
Short: Goonj India is an open, privacy conscious community focussed on Indians and India specific issues.

Description:
About This Server

Ottawa.place is a Mastodon server running the Hometown fork, which is a version of Mastodon with an extra focus on local communities. It is currently administered by @leigh and @andrew. Follow @OttawaPlaceAdmin if you're interested in hearing about future opportunities to chip in and volunteer as the instance grows.

The greater Ottawa region exists on the traditional unceeded territory of the KanienÊ¼kehÃ¡ê‰ka (Mohawk), OmÃ mÃ¬wininÃ¬wag (Algonquin), and Anishinabewaki áŠá“‚á”‘á“ˆá¯á—á‘­ peoples. We are grateful to have the opportunity to provide this service to people present in this territory.

Nous voulons operer un serveur bilingue; les traductions sont en cours. Votre patience est apprÃ©ciÃ©e Ã  cet Ã©gard.

Parliament hill image in the server banner by Suwannee.payne, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons

Federation philosophy

We defederate from instances that engage in harassment or encourage hate speech.

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "â€¦" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM a moderator.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

File Limits

Photos have a maximum file size of 10MB and videos have a maximum file size of 40MB.

Data Location

Ottawa.place user data is stored within Canada, in a server in OVH's Montreal datacentre, along with Amazon Web Services' (AWS) Canada region. Media uploads are stored on AWS's global CDN. Encrypted daily database backups are stored in AWS S3. This may change from time to time but we will do our best to 1) keep things in Canada as much as possible and 2) keep users posted if we need to make big changes to how we store things.

Instance Continuity

If we ever decide to cease running this instance, in accordance with the Mastodon Server Covenant, we commit to a 3-month advance notice before turning off any infrastructure, to allow users to export their content and migrate to a new server.
Short:
Mastodon instance for residents of Ottawa, Gatineau, and surrounding regions.

Description:
Weâ€™re mÃ¸ving!

Weâ€™re moving to https://mastodon.Babb.no. In a few months weâ€™ll shut this server down.

About this server

This is a Norwegian mastodon instance and safe haven for social exchange between tech people from the University of Oslo, Norway. Despite that, this site has no affiliation nor it belongs to the University of Oslo.

It is also opened for other tech people and/or friends from around the world.

The name "babb.be" is because of the love for good kebabs that we share at USIT (University Center for Information Technology at the University of Oslo. On our team, we call them affectionally "babb". Unfortunately, babb.no wasn't available, so the only one was .be. It came to us that "babbe" is used pejoratively for immigrants in Sweden - which is kinda ironic, since the admin of this site has indeed and proudly, a foreign background.

Mastodon Server Covenant

We adhere 100% to the Mastodon Server Covenant. No racism, gender discrimination or anti-semitism will be tolerated.

We have daily backups, and @Gaelle has also access to the server infrastructure in case of emergency.

Transparency

This server runs on a kubernetes cluster with 6 nodes, 3 masters and 3 workers. Each machine has 14gb ram, but we might upgrade them accordingly should there be need for that.

Relays

We joined the following relays:

  • https://relay.babb.be - a relay for Norwegian instances
  • https://relay.intahnet.co.uk
  • https://relay.berserker.town
  • https://relay.instancias-br.online
  • https://relay.beckmeyer.us

Contact

If you need to contact us, send us an e-mail or a toot to @admin.

Blocked servers/instances

We are replicating blocked instances from mastodon.social.
Short: This Norwegian Mastodon server is an unofficial meeting place for University of Oslo people, and more!

Description:
Among the Mastodon universe, I've noticed few distinct types of instances.

  • There are the "flagship" general-interest instances. It is the goal of these instance operators to keep political strife to a minimum (within reason) to make the instance as welcoming as possible to as many users as possible. These tend to be fairly good about removing outright Nazis and hate speech, but politics is often treated as a potentially triggering subject (fair enough). In short, they are run by Liberals. They will embrace calls for solidarity, inclusion, and emancipation insofar as it doesn't undermine the established Liberal institutions. Anything going further seems to stand on shaky ground.

  • There are the special interest instances. Instances focused on subjects from comics to electronics to cooking to LGBTQIA+ and issues of intersectional oppression. I assume many of the operators and members of these instances would like to, more or less, remain out of the fray and focus on these interests. There is a reason their members chose these spaces instead of more mainstream or more explicitly political ones. While many of them may be operated or used by comrades, they don't seem like the correct place to go and talk about Communism 24/7 unless you have a credible reputation in that community.

  • Finally, there are the anti-capitalist instances. These instances are primarily focused on politics, and they are on the correct side of the defining struggle of our epoch - however - among them there is a disappointing amount of sectarianism. I will always assume the best of my comrades, but none of these places (at least the ones with open registration) seem like a good fit for me or many of my comrades from Hexbear.

So my goal here is to establish an anti-sectarian instance along the lines of Hexbear where Anarchists and Marxists are welcome. A space where the focus remains eternally on our leviathan enemy, bourgeois class society, the greatest existential threat to humanity and the planet. A place where a full spectrum of anti-capitalist tactics and theoretical perspectives can be entertained in good faith.
Short: This instance is intended to be a non-sectarian space for leftist discussion, along the lines of hexbear.net (no affiliation), but in a federated microblogging format.

Description: This server was set up with the explicit goal of providing the community of Microsoft Data Platform professionals with a fun, friendly and productive networking space.
Short: dataplatform.social is a social network for Microsoft Data Platform professionals.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

About

tldr.nettime is an instance for artists, researchers, and activists interested in exploring the intersections of technology, culture, and politics.

It has grown out of nettime-l, one of the longest-running mailing lists on the net with a focus on the 'cultural politics of the internet'.

nettime.org

Server

tldr.nettime is based on Hometown, a fork of Mastodon. It's compatible with the wider fediverse, but it also offers two tweaks we hope will help make it particularly engaging and fostering a shared sense of place:

  • The character count per message is higher â€” 2000 chars at the moment.
  • You can choose whether your post is public or visible only on tldr's local timeline

We try to run a stable server, but this is a community effort, so we don't provide guarantees for uptime.

Funding

The server is run by care and free labor of everyone involved. To cover infrastructure cost, we need donations. If you value this instance and have some money to contribute, please do so.

The best way is to send money directly to our bank account.

Account holder: TLDR Association
IBAN: CH50 0900 0000 1607 0884 6
BIC: POFICHBEXXX

You can also a donation form (link to donorbox.org), though processing fees are considerably higher.

Guidelines

Please read the information below before signing up to and/or using tldr.nettime. If you donâ€™t agree to the terms set out here, please do not use this server. It's that simple.

We have a commitment to critical analysis, experiments, mutual care, diversity, and anti-discriminatory practices. The instance is lightly moderated, on an account basis. In other words, we will ban accounts that don't share our commitment.

The community will give itself more detailed rules if necessary.

Language: There are no language rules on this server. English is de facto the main language, but feel free (even encouraged!) to post in other languages.

Content warnings: We do not require a content warning (CW). However, we ask that you be kind and considerate: include CWs if you believe your post may be distressing to others.

Bots: Bots are allowed. Try to make them fun.

Cross-posting: Cross-posting from Twitter, RSS, etc. is fine (and even encouraged if it helps you become more active here).

Topics: You do not need to remain permanently "on topic". The point of this community is to gather like-minded people who will make posts that are interesting to each other. But that doesn't mean that everything has to be about the 'cultural politics of the internet' (whatever that is....). This is a community to connect people, not enforce specific topics of discussion.

Self-promotion: There are many writers, artists, and other cultural producers on this server, and we are more than happy for you to promote your work from your personal account. We request, however, that you do so in a tasteful and not spammy manner.

(Guidelines adapted from zirk.us)

Impressum

This server is run by "TLDR Association", a non-profit association (based on Art. 60ff Swiss Civil Code), registered in Switzerland.

Postal Address:
TLDR Association
Avenue de France 41
1004 Lausanne
Switzerland

Email: tldr AT nettime.org
Short: tldr.nettime is an instance for artists, researchers, and activists interested in exploring the intersections of technology, culture, and politics.

Description:
gaybdsm.group is a Mastodon server where LGBTQ people into or curious about the world of BDSM can discuss and share topics, information, experiences, and even some stories, marks and bruises from scenes. This server is owned, funded, and operated by John @JcbtMI in my spare time.

After joining Mastodon, I quickly found that other servers have been reaching capacity and closing to new registrations. While the capacity of this server is not limitless, this is a way I can give back to the community and provide a safe space for people to immerse themselves in the BDSM world, make new connections, and maybe even make a few new friends or play buddies along the way.

While I am not yet an expert at Mastodon server administration, I sure will try my damn best to do a good job. I have a full-time job and also enjoy BDSM playtime of my own, some of which I get to record and publish videos, so I may not always be available to extinguish fires. My hope is the service which hosts this server is stable enough to run without much intervention.

Feel free to reach out to me via DM, toot or email with any questions or concerns.
Short: This server is devoted to LGBTQ+ people into or interested in BDSM. Share your experiences and learn from others. Perhaps you'll make some connections and learn about BDSM events along the way.

Zum Beispiel fÃ¼r globale Gerechtigkeit, KlimaneutralitÃ¤t, Transparenz, offenen Zugang zu Wissen und Algorithmen oder demokratische Werte. Global denken, lokal handeln mit Menschen und Organisationen die etwas bewegen wollen ğŸš²ğŸ™‚ğŸš¶â€â™€ï¸ğŸŒ»ğŸ¤ğŸš¶â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ¥’âš’.

[EN]
The fairmove.net Mastodon instance is for people who like to engage virtually and in real life. For example for global justice, climate neutrality, transparency, open access to knowledge or democratic values. Or for successful relationships, personally, in an initiative, in politics or professionally - locally or globally.

Operator is the fairkom Gesellschaft, which has set as one of its goals in its statutes, the stimulation of interactive media behavior. We achieve this with open source solutions, single sign-on, federation and a dedicated team in Austria.

Registration is done via the login button with fairlogin. There you can also set your nickname. During registration you need to solve a captcha and answer three questions to keep bots away (yes that sucks, but will be done in a minute).

This instance runs on a Kubernetes cluster with six worker nodes and an external Minio storage with large cache, so it scales well when there are many requests and accesses. We also host and have integrated LibreTranslate to translate toots which are not in your default language.

We finance the operation by selling service packages, donations and consulting and implementation of open source solutions. If you use fairmove.net regularly please order a fairapps basic or pro package. This is also what we understand by fair ğŸ˜‰.

On fairapps.net you can find more alternatives to GAFAM like fair.tube, the meta search engine fairsuch.net which doesn't show ads or create profiles, fairchat, the video conferencing service fairmeeting or the ever popular faircloud. In the Fediverse, fairmove.net is a possible alternative to Twitter and fair.tube works like Youtube, just distributed. We host all services in Europe GDPR compliant and climate neutral.

By the way: fairmove is a generic label for doing good and may also be used for other projects. For this purpose, we have developed the Labels Common License in 2019.

With a passion to move and change: ourselves, organisations, our neighbourhood, the world ğŸš²ğŸš¶â€â™€ï¸ğŸŒ»ğŸ¤ğŸš¶â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ¥’.
Short:
We do, host and support fair moves!

Description:
Welcome to Okla.Social!

Okla.Social is a Mastodon instance for Oklahomans' and is administered by the same.

Funding

We welcome everyone but do ask, that if possible, please help contribute to the operating costs of the server. This server is administered by volunteers and as such, costs are paid directly by them. All proceeds will go towards the operating costs of the server and to help with the growth of it.

Mastodon Server Covenant

We are committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant which includes the following statements.

  • Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia Users must have the confidence that they are joining a safe space, free from white supremacy, anti-semitism and transphobia of other platforms.

  • Daily backups It is important for users to have the confidence that a trip over the power cable or a rogue bit flip will not erase all of their data. Having a backup strategy is a basic necessity of providing a public service.

  • At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure Various circumstances can prevent the original owner of the Mastodon server from answering technical emergencies. For this reason, more than one person must have that capability.

  • Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down

Sometimes services shut down, it is the cycle of life. But users must have the confidence that their account will not disappear overnight, so that they have time to export their data and find another server.

The Team

@jeromyokc - Instance Operator/Admin (He/Him)

Server Status
Short: Come join those Okie's from Oklahoma! A regional instance for those from Oklahoma or just wanted to be associated with them.

Description:
Welcome to the Max Planck Society server on Mastodon! We provide a place for our MPG-family to discuss science, research work, tech, life, and more. First and foremost, we're about building community, and that doesn't always involve scientific discussion, so feel free to go off-topic and have fun!

Who's behind this?

The server is hosted by Max Planck Digital Library (MPDL). MPDL supports MPG scientists from all institutes with a broad service portfolio and provides easy access to data, scientific literature, commercial software licenses, scientific communication tools and services, and research-related software applications. MPDL created for the benefit of the MPG.

General info

MPDL operates this Mastodon instance for the Max Planck Society. All facilities and institutes of the MPG and their employees can use this instance.
Furthermore, users are responsible for their own content. If you are interested in using the Mastodon instance or have questions or reports about the content, please contact mastodon@mpdl.mpg.de. Please note that the MPDL does not guarantee the high availability of the instance.

Code of Conduct

In general: be excellent to each other and respect the rules. â™¡

Keep in mind that our server's aim is community building and sharing of information, ideas, and interests in respect of each other.
The following guidelines are not a legal document, and the final interpretation is up to the administration of ; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies: The following types of content are not allowed: - Any illegal content and activity in the EU - Nudity, pornography, and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions - Hate speech, racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, fatmisia, xenophobia and/or violent nationalism, or the advocation of all of the above will not be tolerated, and any account engaging in such acts will be suspended immediately - Threats of physical violence against any person, animal, or institution - Gore and graphic violence - Spam â€“ No flooding the public timeline with excessive automated posts - Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources.

Also, any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, impede other users from utilizing the service, degrade the performance of the service, harass other users, or incite other users to perform any of the actions above, is disallowed.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Reporting Harassment

To report harassment, please send an email to mastodon@mpdl.mpg.de. If you believe anyone is in physical danger or doing something against the law, please notify appropriate emergency services first by calling the relevant local authorities.

Policies

Your continued use of implies your agreement with our policies. If you disagree with our policies, please discontinue the use of our services.

Impressum

https://www.mpdl.mpg.de/impressum.html

E-Mail-Adresse: mastodon@mpdl.mpg.de
Short: The original server for the Max Planck Society maintained by the Max Planck Digital Library (MPDL). Join the MPG-family!

Description:
Paktodon.Asia is the online public square for the Global South â€“ a safe 'azad' mastodon server (instance) for ordinary citizens, students, and activists, to share, learn, grow, and collaborate in. Though we are all pakistani, Paktodon.Asia is open to friends from across the world!

(Read more about how to sign-up at the bottom :D )

The Team:

Our Woman-led team are all part-time volunteers. If you wish have any questions, or would like to contribute or collaborate in any way, toot at our team accounts:

â€¢ Risham Waseem â€“ Admin / 'Nigraan', @admin@paktodon.asia
(Co-Founder/Director of MaatiTv)

â€¢ Dr. Jibreel Sohail â€“ Moderator / 'Chowkidar', @jibreel_sohail@paktodon.asia
(Medical Doctor)

â€¢ Community Moderator â€“ TBD

â€¢ Official Correspondence Email â€“ paktodon.asia@gmail.com

We will respond as soon as we can (after work!)

SUPPORT OUR INDEPENDENCE!

We are just a bunch of people personally trying to help. Running your own server for the public is expensive. Please support us in keeping Paktodon.Asia independent and online by donating:

â€¢ LiberaPay â€“ donate

â€¢ DM on Insta â€“

Costs:
â€¢ Server Rental â€“
â€¢ Web Hosting â€“
â€¢ Mail Hosting â€“
(We aren't collecting donations yet, as of 2nd July 23)

Our Origin Story

With the ongoing climate-catastrophes and the implosion of vital social media companies, our team realized that our citizens and activists urgently needed a replacement that was more resilient, trustworthy, and sensitive to our needs and cultures - Paktodon.Asia.

The specific needs of both activists and ordinary citizens are never a priority for social media platforms:

What we see is decided by toxic algorithms devoted to commercial interests; Our security and freedoms are overlooked; Our mental health is never even an afterthought.

We intend to counter these challenges by building a tolerant, empathetic, and safe organic community where agency lies with the user.

This mastodon instance strives to be a space where people can come together, form community and join advocacy, create action for the climate fight and social injustices facing us, learn and grow;

or simply just be themselves!

Why Trust Paktodon?

Paktodon.Asia aims to bring our citizensâ€™ voices online, under the premise of safety and trust.

How?

Simple,

we will vet every account joining our instance, whether they remain anonymous or use their real identity.

We will not keep any private data, but we will make sure that every account is a real genuine person (anonymous users), or are who they say they are (real identity users).

Honesty and trust immensely help improve the quality of online discourse.

If you see a user from Paktodon.Asia you can rest easy â€“ they are a genuine account belonging to that person.

Assuring Safety

Paktodon.Asia pledges to follow the Mastodon 'Server Covenant', in addition to our own moderation 'Server Rules' (see below).

However, safety is always an ongoing task: please help our team by reporting any toots (posts) or behaviours you feel do not belong here.

Thanks to mastodonâ€™s design, our Admins are able to use multiple tools to deal with such issues quickly, and will do so!

The Mastodon Advantages

Decentralized = Federated = OpenSource = Social Media

â€¢ Its decentralized servers are all community owned and volunteer run â€“ it can never be bought or controlled.

â€¢ It is federated â€“ all mastodon servers can interact, or choose to block others (like violent or extremist servers).

â€¢ It is fully open-source like the old internet â€“ it is free from corporate influence, AI or surveillance tech.

â€¢ Chronological (instead of AI) feeds with active moderation guarantee a more relaxing experience online. You curate your own feed, and decide what you want to see!

â€¢ There are No Annoying Ads!

The Mastodon Apps

Although there are official apps, Paktodon.Asia recommends Tusky for android users, and Metatext for apple users, due to more features and better UI designs.

There are other great third-party apps as well, and if you would like us to mention them too, let us know! =)

How to Sign-up?

Once you fill out the sign-up form on Paktodon.Asia and submit it, our team will contact you through our correspondence email (paktodon.asia@gmail.com) with the subject "Manual Verification for Paktodon.Asia" to manually verify you.

After we have confirmed you are not a bot, we will immediately activate your account here.

We do this to keep our users safe from bots, harassers, imposters, and other malicious actors. We understand this might sound a bit tedious, but we firmly believe in preventing issues rather than a 'free-for-all' and 'ignore the problem' approach Twitter, Facebook, and other companies indulge in.

This allows us to guarantee Paktodon.Asia users a standard of safety and privacy unmatched by any mainstream social media platform.

We actively look out for you! O=)
Short: Paktodon is an Independent social-platform for the Global South â€“ an â€˜azadâ€™ space for ordinary citizens, students, and activists to share, learn, grow, and collaborate in.

Description:
This is a mastodon server devoted to the JVM (Java) community. As such, it should be useful for developers using that platform and ideally it should be used to talk about our beloved programming language (Java, Kotlin, Scala, Groovy, Clojure... you name it). This is not a fixed rule: you won't be banned from the server if you talk about other topic, but a technical profile is desirable to have a interesting local timeline.

The server is operated by a bunch of volunteers, and it has some cost to keep the infrastructure running, so if you plan to use this server and think it's useful for you, any money contribution is welcome at https://opencollective.com/jvm-social
Short: This is a JVM technologies related mastodon server. Our goal is to have a place to talk about our beloved ecosystem.

Online community for the latest discoveries and research in archaeology and associated disciplines. This server is maintained and managed by the editorial team behind www.heritagedaily.com

Description:
A strange object in space and a space for strange objects

Fediverse instance run by @esther and @james

  • Blog - Updates from admins and mods
  • Status - Information on availability and outages
  • Donations - Help us keep the lights on

strangeobject.space is running on glitch-soc, a fork of Mastodon.

Rules

We acknowledge that rules will never be comprehensive or cover every possible situation. Our instance rules are meant to be respected closely in cases that they do cover and to inform how we act in cases where they aren't explicit. Always try to act in the spirit of these rules.

This instance is hosted in Germany. All content posted on strangeobject.space must abide by German laws and regulations regardless of our own rules.

General

Members must be 18 years old or older.

As members of strangeobject.space we accept these rules and commit to creating an inclusive and respectful environment for ourselves and others.

We do not tolerate oppression of people on the basis of who they are. This includes but is not limited to: gender, race, ethnicity, language, body size and shape, religion or spirituality, nationality, age, disability and sexual orientation.

We define oppression as any language or action that expresses, reinforces, upholds or sympathizes with any form of systemic social domination.

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

  • harassment, both individual and coordinated
  • insults and derogatory language
  • trolling (trying to deliberately provoke someone)
  • threats
  • doxxing (publishing of personal information without consent)
  • spam

Bots, Automation and Organizations

Accounts on strangeobject.space are intended for human beings. Bots are generally not allowed on this instance. Exceptions must be explicitly allowed by the admins of the instance.

Tools that post on behalf on humans, like cross-posters that mirror content from other social media sites, are permitted but should be used with care and only replicate content that their owner has posted themselves (e.g. no retweets). All rules still apply in full to content that is posted through such a tool.

Organizations and institutions should generally not have accounts on strangeobject.space. Exceptions are possible but rare and need to be decided on by the moderators/admins.

Accessibility

Visual media that is posted to the public timeline should always have a text description that conveys its content accurately to someone who cannot see the image.

We avoid large clusters of non-text characters (e.g. Emoji and "glitchy text"), and refrain from using them in usernames at all unless we have actually tested how they are pronounced by a screen-reader and that it doesn't inhibit reading the timeline.

Nudity, Sex and Sex Work, Kink

Discussion and depiction of sexual, erotic, kinky and sex-work related content is explicitly allowed on strangeobject.space as long as it's not illegal in Germany.

Anything that falls into these categories should be posted with a content warning (CW) and media marked as sensitive when the post appears on a public timeline.

Other users should only be tagged in these posts if they have consented to it.

Content warnings

In addition to previous mentions of content warnings (CWs), the following types of content should be posted with a CW when they appear on the public timeline:

  • violence (depiction and graphic description)
  • self harm and suicide
  • dieting and eating disorders
  • citing/quoting content that would violate any of our rules, including screenshots of such content
  • visual media with rapid flashing/blinking

Creative Works

When posting works created by others (e.g. photos, artworks, comics, music, video, etc.), include attribution for the original artist/creator. If possible link back to their original post.

This rule does not apply to the citing of popular media, for example a screenshot or GIF from a movie, or things like memes.

Crypto

We don't tolerate promotion of any cryptocurrency, NFTs, de-fi, and related projects.

Violations, Conflict and Appeals

We strive to own our mistakes and to learn from them. When we receive feedback on our behaviour that we disagree with, our first reaction should be to listen. Many conflicts can be resolved by trying to see them from another person's perspective.

When directly engaging with each other isn't possible for any involved parties, the moderators/admins of strangeobject.space can intervene and will act in accordance with our rules.

Severe or repeated violations of our instance's rules can lead to freezing, limiting and suspending of a user's account.

Moderation decisions can be appealed to either via DM to @admin@strangeobject.space, or if that's not possible (e.g. after suspension) via email to mail@strangeobject.space. Appealing via the personal accounts of moderators or admins on this instance is unacceptable and will result in suspension.
Short: A strange object in space and a space for strange objects

Description:
Server for all music enthusiasts. Concerts, festivals, new music discovery, music collectors, artists, music charts etc.

Registrations only for people aiming to primarily post about music-related subjects.

Code of Conduct

(For the rules scroll down below!!)

This Code contains the rules and principles for participating in the Musicworld.social community. It is intended to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible. This is a working document, so the Musicworld.social team may amend it from time to time.

Goals

  • Provide a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, political affiliation, or other similar characteristic.
  • Create a supportive community, where people freely share their passions and are excited and positive about each otherâ€™s successes.
  • Protect our community from harassment, malicious or illegal content and from individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.

Principles that Guide us

  • We are not a free speech zone. This CoC lays out expected standards of conduct and behavior. You cannot say or post anything that violates these rules or principles and remain a member of our community. You must follow this CoC. If you are looking for something else, please do. It is not here.
  • The Moderators are not morality or thought police. Moderators are guided by this Code of Conduct. Post what you want, if what you post follows these rules, principles and the goals outlined above. Not every member of the community will appreciate controversial or explicit posts so use Content Warnings very liberally. We use Content Warnings so community members themselves can decide whether they want to see or engage with a post that may be controversial or explicit.
  • Bullies, trolls and disruptors are not welcome in Musicworld.social. We will moderate accordingly.
  • This is a voluntary community. You chose to be here. When you choose to join, you have implied that you agree with this Code of Conduct and will follow it.

Rules for posting

The rules you need to follow if you want to be a member of our community are stated below.

General guidance on posting and participating in Mastodon.world

  • Do not post about inflammatory, controversial subjects without a Content Warning. Ideally, you would not post about inflammatory subjects at all. However, it may be acceptable to do so in some cases, but it is never acceptable to post inflammatory content without hiding the content behind an appropriate Content Warning.
  • Do not post any type of nudity without a Content Warning.
  • Regarding Spam: We are not your free advertising platform. If you are here only to sell your products or services, you will be removed. Occasional posts of commercial links are OK, but when the vast majority of a user's posts are commercial in nature, we regard the account as a Spam account. Moderators will evaluate reports of Spam on a case by case basis.
  • Do not engage in name calling, ad hominem attacks, or any other uncivil behaviour. Criticize ideas, never people.
  • Do not report every post that upsets you. Please report posts that violate our rules but for others that you may find distasteful, or just donâ€™t like, use the tools available to you. You can block the user or mute the conversation.

Moderation Principles

Reported content will be assessed on a balance of probabilities by the moderators. In other words, whether it is more likely than not that the content violates one or more of these rules. Moderators will suspend an account from mastodon.world when the user demonstrates that they have breached any rule several times, or if their content (including profile description) suggests that they are likely to continue to break the rules. The number of breaches leading to suspension is deliberately not defined. In egregious cases, one breach can result in suspension of the user account.

The moderation team takes a pragmatic approach to every report they receive - if they feel that a problematic post isnâ€™t explicitly a breach of any of these rules but is inappropriate for Mastodon.world, the post will likely be removed. Users who repeatedly post problematic content or otherwise are seen by the moderators as a negative, disruptive presence in our community can be removed at the discretion of the moderation team, even if those posts or the user did not explicitly violate our rules.

Donations & Finances

Musicworld.social is run by @ruud, who also pays the bills.
Since the November 2022 user influx, those bills have gone up quite steeply.
For those who would like to contribute, the following options for donations are available:

  • OpenCollective (Either recurring or one-time donations) - Preferred.
  • Patreon (Recurring donations only)

The running costs of Mastodon currently consist of:

  • Hetzner server
  • Hetzner backup server
  • Hetzner cloud VPS for monitoring, blog etc
  • Mailgun e-mailer
  • Wasabi storage

Monthly updates about the finances can be found at our blog
Short: Server for all music enthusiasts. Concerts, festivals, new music discovery, music collectors, artists, music charts etc.

Description:
Musician.Social is an instance focused on Musicians and people who love music.

We are committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant.

We are hosted on Masto.host

Please consider supporting our Patreon here.

Note, if you had an account here BEFORE August 22nd, 2023, it is gone. Our previous hosting company crashed. AND the backups they had were not valid. Total failure. We are now on masto.host, and they know Mastodon hosting and backing it up.

If you create an account again with the same login, you WILL get your followers back. However, anything you posted or anyone you followed is gone.
Short: Mastodon site for Musicians and people into Music

Description:
RAP.SOCIAL?

rap.social is a customized Mastodon instance established in December of 2022.

WHY?

rap.social was built by a hip-hop head slash tech geek with the goals of:

  • contributing to the overall Mastodon network effect
  • providing a corporate-free, ad-free environment for myself & others
  • building a grassroots social network for music lovers, artists, ...

WHO?

Registrations are open to the public and posts do not need to be music related, however, please keep in mind the goals above. The best community will involve both diversity and culture fit.

QUESTIONS? SUGGESTIONS? HOLLER!

BDSM ist absolut unvernÃ¼nftig und braucht auch im Fediverse einen Ort um sich zu entfalten.

Wir gehen hier positiv und vorurteilsfrei miteinander um. Wir kommunizieren und fÃ¼hlen uns hier willkommen: UnabhÃ¤ngig von Kink, sexueller IdentitÃ¤t, Herkunft...

Wir haben Stil und nutzen Inhaltswarnungen bei NSFW-Inhalten.

Consent muss ich hier nicht erklÃ¤ren. Der wird erwartet!
Short: BDSM ist absolut unvernÃ¼nftig und braucht auch im Fediverse einen Ort um sich zu entfalten.

Description:
This server is an extension of the SNDevs community.

This is a place for people who share a common interest to gather and be themselves. While we are a community centered around the ServiceNow industry, you can participate and be a part of the server even if you don't necessarily post all ServiceNow content all the time.

Rules

The interpretation of the rules is ultimately up to the administration of the server. If you no longer wish to be a part of the server, you are able to move your account to a different server.

You consent to follow the community guidelines and rules listed below by having your account in or participating in this server.

Funding

We are funded through our Patreon.

Slack

Join slack through invite.sndevs.com.

Emojis

Check out our full Emoji list.

SNDevs Community Guidelines

We really like the Ubuntu Code of Conduct and GDG Community Guidelines and we've modeled our community guidelines based on them.

  1. Be nice. We are all a part of the same community, so be friendly, be welcoming, and be a nice person. Be someone that other people want to be around. We will likely run into each other more than once at Meetups and other events like KnowledgeÂ® and CreatorConÂ®. Leave a good impression.

  2. Be respectful and constructive. We are a very diverse group from numerous countries and backgrounds, so we are not going to agree all the time. Remember to be respectful and constructive with your communication to your fellow community member.

  3. Do not: get into flame wars, make personal attacks, or vent/rant unconstructively. Everyone should take responsibility for their community and take the initiative to diffuse tension and stop a potential flame war or negative conversation as early as possible.

  4. Be collaborative. Work together! We can and should learn a lot from each other. Share- knowledge, help each other out.

  5. Participate. This is YOUR community, so be a part of it! Join in on discussions, show up for in person meetings regularly, give constructive feedback, and offer to help implement that feedback!
Short: The largest independent ServiceNow developer community with over 11,000 registered members and 500 active daily users. SNDevs.com

Description:
Welcome!

This is the PixelFed instance of Bolha.io Community.

We're a Portuguese/English community; Feel free to join us ;)

Visit our site Bolha.io to find out more about us.

# TL;DR

Bolha.io is a community formed by IT people for IT People. It's a safe community with a strict code of conduct.

Our community loves to talk about Dev, Ops, GitOps, CI/CD, IaC, Containers, Cloud Native, Kubernetes, and IT infrastructure.

We also love to talk about life, the universe, nerd stuff, cats, dogs, and more :)

Check our complete rules and conduct code here:

- https://notes.bolha.tools/s/vqhZo4DdB

# Status Page

- status.bolha.us

:)
Short:
This is the PixelFed instance of Bolha.io.

We're a Portuguese/English community. Feel free to join us ;)

We have a rigorous code of conduct; read it first.

Description:
Lanciano.it Ã¨ la storia del web frentano dal 1998.

Qui Ã¨ dove si "incontravano" online i ragazzi lancianesi prima dell'avvento dei social networks.

Dopo 1 milione e mezzo di messaggi scritti sul forum nel corso degli anni, oggi Lanciano.it si apre al futuro!

Accedi all'istanza Mastodon di Lanciano.it per iniziare ad esplorare il fediverso, il nuovo social network libero e decentralizzato.

Nessuna pubblicitÃ , nessuna sponsorizzata, nessun algoritmo, nessun tracciamento, nessuna profilazione. Scegli tu cosa vedere e con chi interagire.

L'accesso al Social Club Ã¨ riservato agli utenti di Lanciano.it. Se hai giÃ  un account su Lanciano.it ma non riesci ad accedere, leggi la guida all'autenticazione

Per maggiori informazioni sull'utilizzo quotidiano di Lanciano.it Social Club, trovi la guida su Lanciano.it Help'n Docs.

Segui anche l'hashtag LoSapeviChe con i tips di Sampei, e non esitare a chiedere se hai dei dubbi!
Short:
Lanciano.it Ã¨ la community dove nei primi anni del 2000 i lancianesi giÃ  sperimentavano quello che sarebbe stato internet con i social.

Nel 2022 lanciano.it rinasce, ed entra nel fediverso.

Short: A Mastodon server for Quakers and other folks who feel like they are part of the world of Quakers. Run by David Coletta of https://threeriversmeeting.org, New England Yearly Meeting. Boston, MA, USA.

Description: You belong here if you like animals. This is not complicated. We are mostly just ferals, which are a subset of furries that admire animals in their natural forms.
Short: We're a small feral furry space for those who want a calmer environment where they can express the all the diverse facets of who they are.

Description:
The Jazztodon instance is for jazz musicians, educators, managers, collectors, critics, publicists, publishers, students, broadcasters, and of course FANS of all types of jazz and related music.

If you'd like to help with the server expenses, it would be much appreciated. Please contact Allen Michie privately.
Short:
The Jazztodon instance is the home on Mastodon for jazz people! Join the discussion of all types of jazz and related music. 

Donations for server expenses: https://tinyurl.com/3sc2y2fs

Description:
Wir sind eine inklusive Mastodon-Community fÃ¼r alle Themen rund um Pen and Paper und Rollenspiel. Wir heiÃŸen alle willkommen, die Teil dieser Community sein mÃ¶chten: Brett-, Rollen-, Gelegenheits- und Partyspielende, sowie Hobbyisten, LARPende, Spieledesignende und -verlegende, Rollenspielcharaktere, KÃ¼nstler*innen, Autor*innen, Streamer*innen, Vlogger*innen und Podcastende, Rezensierende, Lego-Fans, Shop-Inhaber*innen und alle anderen Interessierten.

Wir mÃ¶chten, dass dies ein angenehmer Raum fÃ¼r Menschen ist, die sich an Ideen und Meinungen anderer erfreuen und SpaÃŸ haben wollen. Wir arbeiten aktiv daran, hier eine Kultur von Freundlichkeit, UnterstÃ¼tzung und Respekt und insbesondere fÃ¼r marginalisierte Menschen einen mÃ¶glichst entspannten Raum zu schaffen. Um das zu erreichen, werden die folgenden Regeln angewandt und durchgesetzt.

Ãœber uns

Hier sind die wichtigsten Links, um uns etwas besser kennen zu lernen.

  • Unsere Vision
  • Lerne das Team kennen
  • Unser Moderationskonzept
  • Schreibe uns
  • DatenschutzerklÃ¤rung
  • Impressum

Wir verpflichten uns den Regeln des Mastodon Covenant. Das heiÃŸt, dass wir

  • aktiv gegen Rassismus, Sexismus, Homo- und Transfeindlichkeit vorgehen
  • den Server tÃ¤glich sichern
  • mehr als eine Person Zugriff auf unsere Serverinfrastruktur hat
  • versprechen mindestens 3 Monate Vorwarnzeit zu geben, falls wir beschlieÃŸen die Instanz abzuschalten.

DarÃ¼ber hinaus gelten die folgenden:

Regeln und Etikette

Herzlich willkommen! Wir laden Dich herzlich ein, hier mitzumachen und bitten Dich, ein paar Dinge zu beachten. Wenn du unsere Regeln nachvollziehen kannst und gut damit zurechtkommst, ist das groÃŸartig. Wenn Du etwas davon nicht verstehst, dann recherchiere selbst oder frage uns. Wenn Du die Regeln nicht verstehen willst, suchst Du Dir aber besser einen anderen Ort. Dieser Text ist nicht allumfassend â€“ bitte versuche nicht, RegellÃ¼cken zu finden und auszunutzen.

Sei du

Wir feiern unsere Vielfalt! Du brauchst Dich hier nicht zu verstellen. Sei Dir selbst treu und gib anderen den Raum, das Gleiche zu tun.

Dinge teilen

Sprich Ã¼ber Dinge, die Du vorhast oder fertig gestellt hast! Sprich mit anderen Leuten darÃ¼ber, was sie vorhaben oder gemacht haben! Erstelle Dinge! Teile deinen Patreon, dein Crowdfunding oder deinen Shop! Poste deine Kunst! Empfehle oder booste Dinge, die du unterstÃ¼tzenswert findest! Bots sind willkommen, sofern sie sich an unseren Bot Leitfaden halten (s.u.).

Ein Ort zum Lernen und Wachsen

Wir nehmen uns Zeit, Regeln, Fachbegriffe oder AbkÃ¼rzungen zu erklÃ¤ren, sind offen fÃ¼r Fragen und bieten unsere Hilfe an, wenn wir KapazitÃ¤ten dafÃ¼r haben.

Wir fragen im Zweifelsfall nach (Ã¶ffentlich oder privat), wie etwas gemeint ist, bevor wir darauf reagieren.

Wir Ã¼ben konstruktive Kritik und bieten mÃ¶glichst auch LÃ¶sungsvorschlÃ¤ge oder Alternativen an.

Wir geben einander (und uns selbst) Zeit, Ã¼ber Geschriebenes nachzudenken und erwarten keine sofortigen Antworten. Dies gilt insbesondere, wenn Konflikte entstehen.

Wir entschuldigen uns und Ã¤ndern unser Verhalten, wenn wir Grenzen Ã¼bertreten haben oder Regeln gebrochen haben.

Eine inklusive und rÃ¼cksichtsvolle Umgebung schaffen

Wir gehen respekt- und rÃ¼cksichtsvoll miteinander um. Wir gehen nicht davon aus, dass alle anderen dieselben Erfahrungen im Leben machen wie wir selbst.

Wir akzeptieren die Selbstdefinition aller Menschen. Dazu gehÃ¶rt auch, dass wir fÃ¼r sie die gewÃ¼nschten Pronomen nutzen, sofern sie allgemein bekannt oder in deren Profil erkennbar sind.

Bitte verwende Bildbeschreibungen. Denke immer daran, dass viele Nutzer*innen darauf angewiesen sind und dass wir HÃ¼rden aus dem Weg rÃ¤umen wollen, die es diesen Nutzer*innen unnÃ¶tig schwer machen.

Verwende Inhaltswarnungen (Content-Warnungen; CWs) fÃ¼r sensible Inhalte. Was genau sensible Inhalte sind, ist schwer zu definieren und wir mÃ¶chten keine Vorgaben machen. Aber wenn du vor dem Absenden eines Beitrages kurz nachdenkst, ob eine Content-Warnung sinnvoll sein kÃ¶nnte, tendiere eher zu "Ja" als zu "Nein". Es gibt einige gelÃ¤ufige AbkÃ¼rzungen fÃ¼r Content-Warnungen, die du vielleicht Ã¼bernehmen willst:

  • DEpol fÃ¼r politische Inhalten, die Deutschland betreffen, analog fÃ¼r andere LÃ¤nder, zB ATpol, CHpol etc.
  • mh fÃ¼r Mental Health (psychische Gesundheit) Themen
  • alc fÃ¼r Alkohol
  • nsfw fÃ¼r BeitrÃ¤ge die Gewalt, Nacktheit, vulgÃ¤res thematisieren und meist grafisch Darstellen. Die AbkÃ¼rzung steht fÃ¼r not safe for work, also "nicht fÃ¼r den Arbeitsplatz geeignet"

Menschen, die von Diskriminierungen betroffen sind, sind allerdings nicht verpflichtet, ihre BeitrÃ¤ge Ã¼ber diese Diskriminierungen mit Inhaltshinweisen zu versehen (freiwillige Kennzeichnungen sind natÃ¼rlich trotzdem mÃ¶glich).

Nutzt bei Bedarf bitte individuelle Filter oder schaltet einzelne Leute stumm, wenn ihr bestimmte Inhalte vorÃ¼bergehend oder dauerhaft nicht sehen mÃ¶chtet.

Umgang mit Benachteiligungen und Privilegien

Viele von uns sind in irgendeiner Form marginalisiert (d. h. strukturell benachteiligt) und von Diskriminierungen betroffen. Wir erfahren jedoch nicht alle dieselben Marginalisierungen. Oft haben wir gleichzeitig auch Privilegien im Vergleich zu anderen Menschen. Wir sind daher aufmerksam fÃ¼r unsere gesellschaftlichen Privilegien, das heiÃŸt: strukturellen Machtpositionen und dadurch ungleichen Zugang zu Ressourcen. Wir bemÃ¼hen uns, bei unseren Aussagen und unserem Handeln diejenigen mitzudenken, die unsere jeweiligen Privilegien nicht teilen.

Menschen sind nicht verpflichtet, uns ihre Diskriminierungserfahrungen zu erklÃ¤ren. Wenn wir nicht wissen, wo wir uns zu einem Thema weiterbilden kÃ¶nnen, kÃ¶nnen wir allgemein nach Infoquellen fragen. Wer gerade Zeit und KapazitÃ¤ten hat, kann uns dann Dinge erklÃ¤ren oder mit Links o. Ã¤. aushelfen. Es ist aber niemand verpflichtet, uns mit Weiterbildungsmaterial zu versorgen.

Kein Platz fÃ¼r Diskriminierung und Hass

Homo-, Bi- und Transfeindlichkeit und andere Formen von Queerfeindlichkeit, Rassismus, Behindertenfeindlichkeit, Sexismus und andere feindselige Einstellungen dieser Art akzeptieren wir hier nicht. Nazi oder TERF zu sein ist keine Meinung. Es ist beschissen, aggressiv und langweilig â€“ geh damit woanders hin. Es steht Dir frei, Deine Meinung woanders zu Ã¤uÃŸern, wo niemand von uns Dich hÃ¶ren muss. Hier ist kein Platz fÃ¼r Hass. Dies wird von der Moderation streng durchgesetzt. Wir ermutigen unsere Community auÃŸerdem, Leute, die Hass verbreiten, individuell zu blocken.

Wenn wir feststellen, dass eine Instanz den Zweck hat oder massiv dazu genutzt wird, Leuten, die unserer Community Schaden zufÃ¼gen, eine Heimat zu geben, werden wir darÃ¼ber nachdenken, die ganze Instanz zu blocken ("defÃ¶derieren"). Das werden wir nicht leichtfertig und nur nach intensiver AbwÃ¤gung tun. In der Regel sehen wir die individuelle MÃ¶glichkeit zu blocken, die alle einzelnen Anwender*innen haben, als ausreichend an.

BelÃ¤stigungen werden nicht geduldet, unterdrÃ¼ckerisches Verhalten wird nicht toleriert. Wenn Du die Grenzen Anderer nicht anerkennst, werden wir ggf. zunÃ¤chst versuchen, Dich freundlich aufzuklÃ¤ren. Wiederholte VerstÃ¶ÃŸe gegen unseren Verhaltenskodex, unsere Regeln und Etikette werden allerdings nicht toleriert und kÃ¶nnen im Ernstfall zur LÃ¶schung des Accounts fÃ¼hren.

PersÃ¶nliche Angriffe sind unerwÃ¼nscht. Der Wunsch nach einem freundlichen Umgangston rechtfertigt jedoch kein Tone Policing, wenn marginalisierte Menschen auf Diskriminierung hinweisen oder sie kritisieren.

Halte dich ans Gesetz

MaÃŸgeblich sind die Gesetze in Deutschland. Insbesondere Copyright-VerstÃ¶ÃŸe werden nicht geduldet. Wir behalten uns vor, gesetzeswidrige Inhalte nicht zu lÃ¶schen, sondern zu sichern und anzuzeigen.

Serversprachen sind Deutsch und Englisch

Wir bitten dich um VerstÃ¤ndnis dafÃ¼r, dass wir ausschlieÃŸlich deutschsprachige und englischsprachige Inhalte akzeptieren kÃ¶nnen, um unserer Verantwortung gegenÃ¼ber der Community gerecht zu werden. Anderssprachige Inhalte kÃ¶nnen wir schlicht nicht ausreichend verstehen, um sie im Zweifel prÃ¼fen zu kÃ¶nnen.

Moderation

Aktuell gehÃ¶ren dem Moderationsteam 5 (fÃ¼nf) Personen an. Gib ihnen fÃ¼r Antworten und Aktionen bitte 24 Stunden Zeit. Dieser Server wird von Menschen in ihrer Freizeit betrieben. Hier findest du unser Moderationskonzept.

Um einen Beitrag zu melden, klick auf das MenÃ¼ mit den 3 Punkten und dann auf "melden". Du kannst einen oder mehrere BeitrÃ¤ge auswÃ¤hlen. Bitte fÃ¼ge auch eine Notiz hinzu, um der Moderation mitzuteilen, warum du die BeitrÃ¤ge meldest.

Das letzte Wort hat das Moderationsteam.

Wenn du mit jemandem aus dem Moderationsteam ein Problem hast, wende dich an @spielleitung. Wenn du mit @spielleitung ein Problem hast, wende dich ans Moderationsteam @moderation. Wir verpflichten uns dazu, auch unser eigenes Verhalten kritisch zu hinterfragen und uns bei Bedarf gegenseitig zu moderieren.

Servermitteilungen

Du solltest @spielleitung folgen. Der Account ist hauptsÃ¤chlich dazu da, Neuigkeiten und AnkÃ¼ndigungen zum Betrieb der Instanz zu melden und postet nur selten.

Auf den Schultern von Gigant*innen

pnpde.social nutzt freie Software und wir sind der Entwicklungscommunity dankbar, dass sie ihre Arbeit uns und anderen zur VerfÃ¼gung stellen. Es sind zu viele, um sie hier alle zu wÃ¼rdigen - manche kennen wir selbst nicht. Es folgt eine Auswahl:

  • Mastodon
  • BookWyrm
  • YOURLS
  • BookStack
  • Framadate
  • FreeBeeGee
  • WBO
  • Etherpad
  • Zabbix
  • Ubuntu
  • MySQL
  • PostgreSQL

tabletop.social und Plotbunny Games

Diese Regeln basieren auf denen von tabletop.social und denen des Verlags-Discords von Plotbunny Games. Diese Vorlagen wurden mit der Erlaubnis der Verfassenden verwendet.

Game-Icons und Font-Awesome

Wir benutzen die Icons der Game-Icons.net Bibliothek, die unter einer Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported (CC BY 3.0) lizensiert sind und die Icons der Font-Awesome Bibliothek, die unter einer Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) lizensiert sind.

Bot Leitfaden

Wir mÃ¶chten, dass unsere lokale Timeline fÃ¼r Menschen interessant ist, deshalb haben wir einige Sonderregeln fÃ¼r Bots formuliert.

  • Bots mÃ¼ssen in ihrem Profil als solche markiert sein ("Dieses Profil ist ein Bot" anhaken)
  • Im Profil des Bots muss die Person genannt sein, die ihn betreibt.
  • Bots, die Ã¶ffentlich posten, dÃ¼rfen dies nicht Ã¶fter als einmal pro Stunde tun. Bots die ungelistet posten, dÃ¼rfen dies nicht Ã¶fter als viermal pro Stunde tun.
  • Bots dÃ¼rfen keine anderen Accounts markieren, es sei denn, der andere Account hat dies initiiert.
  • Alle Regeln, die fÃ¼r normale User gelten, gelten auch fÃ¼r Bots.
  • Wir behalten uns vor, Bots besonders streng zu prÃ¼fen. Dies gilt insbesondere fÃ¼r Bots, die thematisch unpassend sind.
Short: Wir sind eine inklusive Mastodon-Community fÃ¼r alle Themen rund um Pen and Paper und Rollenspiel, oder kurz: #pnpde
